Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: tinchantilly
Reviews.Content: Stayed in #1407. We heard lots of street noise well into the night. Room had a funky smell which either dissipated throughout the week or we just got used to it. The room seemed clean except for the stained upholstered chairs - not very inviting. On the positive side - the room was very large with a very large (and powerful) shower. Nice toiletries too. I would recommend spending a few extra dollars to stay somewhere a bit nicer and perhaps closer to the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A really good option in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: hlhbDenmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Cambridge Hotel. It has a very good location within walking distance to Circular Quay. Given that Sydney generally is so expensive, Cambridge is affordable. So it can be highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ellemorena
Reviews.Content: After scouring the net for a decent place in Sydney we've come to the conclusion that Sydney is quite on the expensive side of the scale for what you are getting (value over price), one of them is accommodation. Even more challenging when you are party of 3 and way past the age of dorm rooms. We are very glad (and thank you trusty fellow Tripadvisor) to found Cambridge Hotel on here. We booked the Deluxe Room with balcony facing the city vew for quite a good price. It had a double bed and the spacious sitting area got converted into another double bed, plus another single bed - all in all we had 2 double beds and a single bed, 5 luggages, 3 hand carry bags, 2 computers bags and still have huge room to move around and did a mini concert before a night out with MTV blasting off the telly. Basically it was a very, very comformtable space for 3 hyper active people. The bathroom was huge (it comes with a bathtub), fluffy fresh towels and toilettries (not quite L'Occitane nor Molton Brown but great house brand anyway). The room was made and cleaned everyday; and great applause for the housekeeping team for keeping our rooms really clean despite all our personal effects strewn all over (and not one thing got missing!). We stay at total or 4 nights and everything was just perfect. Considering they really didnt a room for 3 - they were accommodating enough to transfrom ours into a really comfortable space. Oh they have an amazing shower! Now the location: 2 words: gay village. And you know what comes with in the gay village, you ask? all the chicest resturants, bars and stores and really fabulous colonial houses in the chic vintage balcony. walking around Surry hills, having coffee and coctails should be a thing to do in Sydney, apart from the visit to the Opera house. This place is just lovely minus the tourist riff-raffs. So Cambridge Hotel really lucked out on the location. Highly recommended and this will be my home next time I am in Sydney or if any of my friends are.

Reviews.Title: “Warning! Beware of the building work.”
Reviews.Author: Mark V
Reviews.Content: I feel compelled to write a review of the property to ensure that I warn people about the building work happening here. We stayed in this hotel 2 weeks ago and they are building an extension. The work starts at 7am most mornings and is noisy, which can be very annoying. I can understand that they must do work, but it is the way in which it is done. I complained in a very factual and positive, polite manor, to give management a chance to offer compensation, or an explanation as to why they did not warn people of the building work beforehand, or at least not put us right next to the work. Unfortunately they could do neither to make us feel happier about our stay here. They had no answer to the fact that they did not pre-warn you or not to put you up on the first/second floor of the hotel. The hotel would otherwise be a nice place to stay with no complaints - but management should not be congratulated for their handling of this situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: samantha h
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our 1st trip to Sydney from the UK. Bright and modern hotel with clean and spacious rooms. Great location in Surrey Hills area. Restaurants, bars, shops etc all nearby. The Australian Museum is within walking distance and abit further (about 40 mins) is the Sydney Opera House. Friendly, helpful staff. Great full/and continental breakfast available which was plenty for us. The only negative thing of our stay were the noisy building works that were going on next door when we were eating breakfast, and even though we had a good view from balcony (side room), we were right opposite an apartment block and could see right into their rooms but I suppose that can't be helped!! If we return to Sydney, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: FrenchKisses68
Reviews.Content: All I can say is: "Excellent" We just had a little Baby Boy and going by myself into the City with a then 7 weeks old was a fantastic experience since stopping at the Cambridge. Upon arrival I've been greeted very friendly by the reception staff and felt very comfortable. Sarah, was lovely helping me on check in (it's not the easiest with one hand and a crying baby) and get to my room quickly. She also offered me a fold out baby bed, which I forgot to ask for upon reservation. Reception staff are very friendly and every time I crossed the lobby I got a smile and even a small talk with my Baby. The reservations team was very professional, recommending the right room (premium) and pointing out special rates, which was great since being on a budget. The Lady (Jenar?) was very bubbly and explained everything very clearly incl. all policies and what to bring like ID ect. I had to call again for another question and Richard already was aware of my special request for a quiet room and confirmed everything again as booked with the lovely Lady. It was great not having to repeat myself. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. Definitly will be back again and would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for professional and friendly service in a affordable hotel, close to the City. M&M

Reviews.Title: “No need to look for anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: chris mccall
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Cambridge last year, and were so pleased that we decided there was no need to consider another hotel. The location is great: close to Museum station, even closer to bus stops on Oxford Street allowing easy access to Sydney's attractions. Get a my-multi ticket to make the most of the excellent public transport. A short walk up to Crown Street with excellent restaurants and bars. Staff are pleasant and helpful, and rooms are well kept and comfortable. If we return to Sydney next year we will stay at the Cambridge without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Package”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneTruci
Reviews.Content: Whenever I am in Sydney, I head straight for the Cambridge Hotel. This classy hotel ticks all the boxes:- Great location; Friendly, helpful and efficient staff; Clean and comfortable rooms; Reasonable tariff. I consider it the 'perfect' choice for everyone, even the most discerning guest.

Reviews.Title: “Matt & Alli”
Reviews.Author: Matt P
Reviews.Content: Our stay with Family and friends in Sydney for our wedding was made even better by the staff and facilities at the Cambridge Hotel Sydney. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and always went out of their way to ensure they could help us with any problems/directions or requests we had. The rooms were great , clean and well serviced. The location was fantastic, close enough to the downtown of the city that we could walk in , but far enough out to have some peace from the bustle of the city. The amenities surrounding the hotel make this a great location to stay with restaurants with in 5 minutes walking distance, but be sure to eat at the in house restaurant at the hotel as well, great food and service there as well. Overall a great hotel and will be staying there again when we return to Sydney to visit friends.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate at best.”
Reviews.Author: ordianryguy
Reviews.Content: The Cambridge Suites could use an update. The location is great for those wishing to be near the Oxford St. attractions but the room decor and furnishings could do with a little attention. The kitchen area in our suite was barely serviceable for a week long stay and the fridge was tiny. One look at the dingy pool and spa area told me I would not be using it during our visit. The staff, however, were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: Julie255338
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Cambridge many times and wouldnt stay anywhere else in Sydney. The location is great ,staff friendly and helpful and rooms are spacious and clean. Close to everything including transport. Railway station is just a short walk which can get you to anywhere in Sydney you might need to go. Also just a short walk to the city. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy!”
Reviews.Author: Simon B
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest, friendliest hotels I have ever stayed in (and I stay in a lot through my work). Very efficient and friendly staff, good sized very clean rooms and close to some of the best bars and restaurants around. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Everything Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Susan T
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault anything at the Cambridge.Great location,easy access to everyhting. Staff were all very friendly and helpful .Very clean and good sized room. Would definitely stay there again and work recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Emily777_12
Reviews.Content: It's very convenient to access almost everything in the city and highly recommend for a short trip travelers as well as business. You'll enjoy the whole experience through warm welcome at the reception and their service. I will definately recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Gilmore_75
Reviews.Content: Took the family to Sydney for the weekend & stayed at the Cambridge on Riley street located in Surry Hills. Location was really good for our weekend. Close to everything. Will definately stay there again. Very well prepared. Prompt service & large open rooms. No waiting around when checking in/out!! (which is a bonus when you have kids!)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to Fault”
Reviews.Author: Bob C
Reviews.Content: A great experience from the reservation desk greeting until the time I departed. Close to everything and easy to get around. The cleanliness, the service and the food were all exceptional. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “operas and cambridge”
Reviews.Author: stevefi
Reviews.Content: hi im steve from charters towers and two things that my uncle recomended that i should do. go to sydney, and watch the operas. well the operas really impressed me and im glad that i stayed at his choice of hotel. he lives in sydney and he always recomends to all his family and clients to stay at the cambridge hotel. i can see why. i love to travel and i rarely experience the level of friendliness given by the staff here. it was good to see receptionists with an open smile, clean modern rooms with doors that open onto your own balcony. its close to all the facilities of oxford street and a short enjoyable walk to the opera house. i have stayed elsewhere before but i now know where to stay in sydney. at the cambridge. i would definately reccomend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Get Away in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Karon S
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay at the Cambridge Hotel just recently from the friendly helpful reception staff to the elegantly furnished rooms, plenty of room to move around the room even with heaps of baggage and the cleanliness second to none, also a deluxe bathroom with a fantastically large shower. The topper was a delightful balcony with city views 5 star accommodation at reasonable prices. You wonâ€™t be disappointed if you book your Sydney get away here.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: benmp
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends while in town to celebrate a 50th birthday, easy access to anywhere in Sydney! I have stayed at the Cambridge many times before and can not say enough good things about it. Consistently great service time and time again. Will definitely be back. Oh the beds are most comfortable as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Cambridge Hotel will not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: nilmatter
Reviews.Content: Great value stay in Sydney, local to everything. The staff were amazing and always helped if I needed anything. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. All round great stay and would highly recommend. I Did not try the restaurant food as there was always so many options to eat out in the area, but I did see many others doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Customer relations at its best”
Reviews.Author: MMRB1
Reviews.Content: After writing a review about our lack of communication received by the Cambridge Hotel on 18th February 2012, we are pleased to report that both Steven and Paul have restored our faith in good old Customer Relationships. Not only have they addressed the matter at hand but have kept us in the loop whilst doing their investigations. I am sure if these two had received our issue in the first place there would never have been a negative review written. Thanking you both for your deligence and thorough investigations. You are a credit to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Kellukey
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, happy to store our bags when arrived early and departed late. 30 mins walk to the Rocks, just off Oxford street. Close to all facilities, public transport, restaurants etc. rooms are fine for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Will go back.”
Reviews.Author: panixxxx
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to Sydney and I wish I knew of this hotel earlier. It is located between Surry Hills and Darlinghurst and off the popular Oxford Street. Surry Hills town is around a 10m walk with all its restaurants, cafes and bars. It takes under 10m to Hyde Park and the nearest City Rail stop. The bus stop was very close which could go either to Bondi or Circular Quay. Always buy a mycity bus pass before from a 7/11 stores and elsewhere as most buses are pre-pay only. I opted for a deluxe room which was huge! It was on the 15th floor facing the street with a balcony. I am a very slight sleeper but there was not much street noise day or night but next time will request away from street. You could hear people from other balconies though. The TV had many decent channels. The bed was extremely comfortable. There was a sofa and an office desk for those who need it. The staff were extremely friendly. The wifi is chargeable. I would buy a Virgin Mobile broadband dongle from Pitt Street which costs around AUD$29 for a lot of data and it is fast! There are PCs located in the lobby as well as tour information. There is a breakfast room but did not use it. I found the area quite safe to walk at night. Like anywhere have your wits about you! Upon check out they charged me for car park which I didn't use but this was removed with delay. Like most Australian hotels, 1030am is the checkout, maybe free to 11am but AUD$20 for each hour after.

Reviews.Title: “Colourful surroundings!”
Reviews.Author: mickhemel
Reviews.Content: As this was our first visit to Sydney we were not aware of the history of Oxford Street. Yes, we arrived the Sunday after Mardi Gras and then realised the alternative entertainment on offer! Room was clean and tidy with balcony. Bed could have been more comfy. Very easy to walk to city centre via Hyde Park and onto Opera House etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ozal_9
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay at the Cambridge Hotel. Visiting Sydney with friends from overseas and was impressed from check in to check out. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. We were checked in promptly and assisted with our bags up to our room. The front desk staff were always smiling and prompt with any questions. We were located on level 9 of the hotel and had a great view of the city and even a view of the opera house. The room contained all the mod cons needed for our trip. The room was serviced daily and was always spotless. The mini bar was reasonable and the TV a good size with a great selection of channels, and most importantly the bed was very comfortable The hotel was located in a great part of the city, Surrey Hills coffee shops and eateries on your doorstep, walking distance to hyde park and the CBD and a 2min walk to bus stops for destinations all over the city. We could not have chosen a more central location and walked to all tourist sights and destinations Overall we were very impressed with the value for money, great customer service and friendly staff, thanks for making our trip to Sydney a great one and we will be back again

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ann F
Reviews.Content: I had a brilliant stay at the Cambridge. The staff were friendly, the room was comfortable and clean. The room was cleaned and the bed made every day, clean towels provided and soap, shampoo re-stocked. It is convenient for everything - you can walk to the CBD, the Harbour, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, Central Station, the beaches are a bus ride away, and there are plenty of good bars and restaurants nearby. Thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but Mardi grad premium was a bit rich.”
Reviews.Author: donaldasher
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights over Mardi grad weekend, room rate on Saturday of the parade was $399, which is very steep. I have stayed here on a regular basis over the last 10 years and there has been little improvement or upgrading of rooms, linen is of poor quality, and the lifts are always a problem, as there are only 2 minuscule lifts for a 14 story hotel. Cupboard space in the 'deluxe balcony room' was tiny and poorly designed. Position makes up for a lot of the downsides

Reviews.Title: “Affordable & Appealing Accommodation at its Best!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Chappy77
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Cambridge Hotel to enjoy the sights and sounds of Sydney and catch up with some friends that I hadn't seen in ages. I have to say that my trip from start to finish was exceptional! When it comes to staying away from home I am a bit of prude and very frugal with my money. I want the best value for it but also at the same time except that you cant expect to have 5* accommodation on a 1* budget! (I'd be an idiot if I thought I could actually get it for this!) This is where I think the Cambridge has hit the spot, affordable yet appealing accommodation at its best! The service was fantastic, on arrival I was able to park my car in the multi storey car park below the hotel. Although this is not part of the hotel its ideally situated if you drive. I took the elevator up to reception where I was greeted with a warm smile and friendly hello by a lady named Donna. She checked me in nice and quickly, the usual protocol credit card, fill in your details etc and I was whizzed off to my room 1208! Something to note is that only guests with a room key card can gain access to your floor before the lift will operate, leaving me feeling safe and secure that not every Tom, Dick or Harry can access the hotel. On entry to my room the view was fantastic, it was clean, fresh and had all the mod cons needed; phone, wifi - prepaid, iPhone doc, desk, lounge area, large tv with Foxtel (it even had the sports channel!), mini bar which was very well priced a beer was only $4.00 and air con. Where the hotel was located was another great benefit, it is in the heart of Surry Hills and a 1 minute walk onto Oxford street where all the bars, clubs and restaurants are and if you want to head into the CBD then that will take you 15-20mins scenic walk through Hyde Park or a taxi ride 5-10mins costing $10-$15.00 (there is plenty of public transport also). In the mornings I had breakfast in the 212 cafe, I was served by Adam, very professional & polite, he was quick and efficient with my order leaving me little time to time to read my complimentary news paper lol. On one of the evenings I had to organise a restaurant for me and my friends to go to, so I asked the reception desk if they could recommend anywhere. I was greeted by a lady called Sarah, again like all the other staff I had spoken to during my stay, she was knowledgable & friendly and knew loads about the local area. She recommended a pizza place around the corner from the hotel called Mad Pizza. She also recommended a pub across the road from the hotel called the Porter House, a lively Irish pub, with special $10.00 meal offers and a pub quiz on a Wednesday. However I opted for the pizza place, if you get the chance I certainly encourage dining here, the pizza's are devine and again the service is second to none, polite friendly and efficient! Whilst on my stay I also found out that they are splitting the hotel in to three separate hotels. They are currently building a new section which is due to finish in August 2012. It is going to be a 5* serviced apartment type hotel leaving the Cambridge to remain at 4* and another part of the hotel to be 3* giving lots more variety to those with different budget types! Fantastic concept! Lastly, although it may be seen as a negative, they dont have a gym within the hotel, however they have arranged for guests staying to have free access to a gym around the corner called Boxing Works (www.boxingworks.com.au). It is actually quite nice to leave the hotel especially when it is in bid to get some exercise! Being a regular gym user, I do like a clean and friendly place to work out, this place is great! Although it is mainly martial arts users, the gym was clean, I could find the weights where I needed to, cardio machines were sweat free, no intimidating Personal Trainer looking over my shoulder and the staff are polite & friendly. I recommend doing a Boxercise class I did the 6.15pm class on Monday, it was busy but the atmosphere was amazing! The three nights I spent there were brilliant, and I had a really good nights sleep on all occasions, the bed was comfortable & clean, and the pillows are to die for! The level of service I received was great, the staff were friendly & polite right from the smiley House Keepers to the Managers on reception, always willing to please, they honestly couldn't do more for you. I would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family members to come and stay! Thank you for an amazing stay and I will be sure to check in soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sus2505
Reviews.Content: Went to Sydney for a friend's wedding and we wanted a central hotel which was nice and clean as we would be out and about most days. The Cambridge ticked all the boxes - walking distance to the city centre and close to all the great small cafes and restaurants in Darlinghurst and Surry Hills. The staff are super nice and helpful, the rooms are nice and the views from the 14th Floor were stunning. The only issue we had was the time the check in took but that was such a small thing.

Reviews.Title: “Olivia newton John concert overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Catvorm
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable overnight stay. Very friendly helpful staff. The room was very clean and tidy. The view was great and only a 15 minute taxi ride to the opera house. The reception were very fiend lay and welcoming. Will definitely stay Again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,cosy clean, affordable, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Terrie E
Reviews.Content: Have booked again for a family city adventure! With War memorial, Botanic gardens, Opera house and fantastic food all within walking distance., We caught the ferry across to Darling harbour, Loved how close it was to everything we needed. The beds are dreamy comfy and staff were friendly and helpful. We had a dip in the inndoor pool after a hot Summers day, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but some let downs spoilt our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Amy_Lea_10
Reviews.Content: Before reading on its only fair I make you aware that following several complaints to the staff and finally the hotel manager we did get some compensation for the problems we experienced. Both me and my partner were happy with this - but I still think its important to be honest about our time at this hotel. The location is great - only a 25 minute walk through the CBD to the iconic Sydney harbour front - with the bridge and Opera House. The hotel is in an area called Surry Hills - a very trendy area with lots of lovely bars and places to eat just round the corner. Crown Street in particular will leave you spoilt for choice. The hotel rooms are basic but have a good showers and ours was very spacious too. However - we felt let down by our time here. First of all - there was a power cut on one of the nights - with not notice to tell us so when we returned hot and sweaty from our harbour bridge climb. We had to fumble around in pitch black corridors before returning to reception to ask what was going on. We had no air con, no flushing toilet (properly anyway), no hot shower and of great concern there was no fire exit signs lit up anywhere as I am sure they are supposed to be in case of a power cut. It was finally resolved at 11pm at night - it went off at 11.30am. The sheets in our room were not changed for the whole five nights we were there - wet used towels were left on the floor, glasses that we'd used to drink from were not replaced, the sides were left dusty and the fridge was never cleaned - despite the fact it all melted during the power cut. We complained about all the above - but to no effect. The internet is a total rip off - we paid $12 for 2 hours - failing to complete even one task in that time. When we complained - we were told to ring the provider ourselves to get a refund. Not acceptable. The staff tried to help but check out was slow and communication between staff was poor. In all - if you are doing Oz on a budget - I would look at other hotels first before this one. Its not terrible - but little improvements would go a long way to making a happier stay.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than it looks”
Reviews.Author: Bob_the_Fireman
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the initial appearance of the hotel the room we had was more than adequate The girls on the front desk are really helpfull. We arrived from Dubai at 07:00 to be told our room wouldn't be available until 2 pm however the girls showed us to a shower room where we could freshen up and get changed. They also took our number and contacted us around 12 to let us know our room was ready The hotel is clean comfortable and ideally situated being just a short walk from many attractions. An ideal base for our short trip A couple of "niggles" I wasn't too happy about we're 1. The credit card holding of $100 dollars for items extras we were told wouldn't be repaid for 10 working days. Which is FAR TOO LONG 2. Try and avoid a room overlooking the police station and the Irish pub as it gets very noisy on a weekend Other than that it was fine

Reviews.Title: “As always, everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: ZHN555
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th time staying at the Cambridge. I dont think we will ever stay anywhere else when we visit Sydney. The staff are all so polite and friendly, nothing is a trouble for them. We spent a bit extra this visit and stayed in high floor room with a balcony, it was truely amazing, sunrise from the 13th floor is a must see. We will be back in March.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Tess13
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be good value but now that the prices have gone up a lot it's not so good. Perfectly clean and comfortable but a bit overpriced. Great location. Walking distance to Central station, Surry Hills resaturants and very close to Oxford St.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FOOT99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel for two nights recently (Mon/Tues), great location. Split air con a bit noisy and located bedside, lifts slow, tv clarity quite poor, front desk slow but staff try. Room clean & tidy. Reasonably priced and would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: Xander D
Reviews.Content: Booked on Webjet paid 666.00 for nights when arrive they give us two single beds , single double apparently means two singles, then they charge an extra $140 for a queen bed , staff useless takes 20 minutes to change our room, UHD milk was even in our room, I think I trained 6 people on how to use their lifts even in front of staff , not happy Jan

Reviews.Title: “Cambridge- Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: WorldAdviser
Reviews.Content: From when we arrived there ( besides that car park which the hotel doesn't have any control over considering it is based in the middle of Surry Hills one cant complain about parking because it is gods send there is actually one there) we were impressed, the funky decor and helpful receptionists checked in and everything went smoothly. The room was up high, deluxe room, clean and very comfortable bed. It is not 5 star luxury but the room was clean and did not have any odours, the bathroom also very clean and there was more than enough room to lounge around considering that most of the time you are not in the room anyway. Overall a wonderful place to stay, reasonably priced, and definitely worth the location. ( Just a short stroll to Billy Kwongs).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, choose room carefully”
Reviews.Author: SusanM22
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for shopping on Oxford St, towards Paddington, and for cafes and restaurants on Crown St. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Hyde Park, Darling Harbour and downtown (15-20 mins). Or you can take the bus from Oxford St to downtown stores and Circular Quay. It's also on the bus route to Bondi Beach. If you stay at this hotel during the week, you will pay a lot less for the room. The price was reasonable Monday to Thursday but increased dramatically on Friday and Saturday nights. We had booked and paid for a Premium room with two double beds and had to insist on that at reception when we were initially offered an inferior room with one large bed and a rollaway. The Premium room we eventually got on the 7th floor was very comfortable for our 5 night stay, with a pleasant view over trees, looking west. Traffic noise was minimal. The breakfast buffet in the hotel was really basic and poor value. We enjoyed our breakfasts at "The Goods", a great little cafe, round the corner on Crown St.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families on a budget that still want all the comforts, but choose room wisely.”
Reviews.Author: mumdadkids101
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for 2 nights on the advice of other travellers ,and found the double bed x 2 room perfect for our needs.It was clean and neat and had obviously been updated recently. We had a balcony overlooking the street and a big sliding door that let in fresh air instead of just using the air con all the time. At no stage of our stay were we bothered by excessive traffic noise even when the door was open at night overlooking the street.This hotel is close to the city after all. The desk staff were really pleasant and helpful when we needed extra towels for the pool etc and always acknowledged us as we passed thru reception. The pool and spa were adequate for the kids , but it does get rather noisy and we were glad we did not get a room on that level as your door is very close to the edge of the pool !! Its location means that you are really close to Oxford street, a supermarket, Chinatown and the Sydney Police station ( we felt very safe!) .We skipped the expensive hotel breakfast for a great brekky wrap and cofee at a cafe 2 mins walk away called The Bean Temple before we headed out on our daily walk into the city to see the sights. However, on our first morning there, we were woken at 7.15am to the sound of jack hammering vibrating through the walls and floor. When we called reception to find out what it was ,we were told it was from the construction site next door and they had just begun the jack hammering this week. Management is apparently in negotiation with the builder and council over start times for this part of the build, but it was a real pain to wake up to. The staff offered immediately to move us to another room and apologised proffusely. Our next room was just as good and we all slept in peacefully the next morning tucked away from the noisy vibrations. I would recommend this hotel to those wanting location , clean amenities and affordability especially if you plan on spending most of your holiday money seeing the sights of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: ian1762
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1000 on New Years Eve and found it very frustrating (after travelling for 29 hours) when told that we couldn't have our room until 1400 even though the lady on reception informed us that it was empty! She was not interested in helping us. She was Eastern European. At 1230 my wife complained and she gave us a room on the advice of the porter! I don't think it was what we paid for but it was adequate. That being said the rest of our stay was comfortable. The room 704 was quiet and very clean. Samantha and Chris on reception were excellent. They assisted us in any way they could and always very friendly. They confirmed all our arrangements. We felt very safe in the area even late at night and the amenities were very good. Well situated for the city if you don't mind some walking but very well situated for public transport. Some of the complaints are totally unjustified. I would recomend a stay here. Ideal for this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: ceneri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cambridge for 4 nights. The room was very clean and comfortable, and the hotel interiors felt fairly new. Amenities were basic, but for the price, the hotel was better than expected. The one issue we had was with the wifi, which is quite pricey, very slow, and handled by a third party, so when we had problems with our voucher, the hotel desk was unable to help.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- Pity About The Wifi Service.”
Reviews.Author: Mal033
Reviews.Content: The hotel got off to a bad start. First they overcharged me against my prepaid internet booking but this was soon resolved by e-mail and I received a credit. When we booked in, the gentleman on reception then tried to charge me again for the pre-paid room, after some convincing he finally agreed that we had pre-paid. He then gave us a room with two single beds rather than the double ordered, with no explanation or apology. The next issue was with the wifi, having purchased a voucher at an exorbitant cost for one hour which I had to go to the reception area to get an internet connection as I was unable to get a signal in my room. The one hour voucher ran out after about 15 minutes. In America and the UK this ia a complimentary service but 3 of the 16 hotels we stayed at on this holiday charged for wifi! However, this hotel was by far the most expensive and the worst service. In fairness the front desk were very helpful in trying to resolve the difficulties with the wifi, which in the main turned out to be due to their service provider. All these incidents were unfortunate because actually, this is very nice hotel and with a little more attention to detail and decent wifi system would be a very good one! The rooms were nicely furbished, comfortable and clean. Apart from the booking in- process the front desk staff especially Dona and Ledir were efficient, very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Jumped Up-graded Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paubranco
Reviews.Content: Near to Oxford Street and nightlife, if that's where you want to be. Hotel seems to have been renovated and jumped up into higher category in terms of price, when it really is just a standard basic kind of place. But, everything seems newish and comfortable enough and works. Except for the windows. Even on a high floor, conversations from the street below sounded like they were right outside the window. Amazing acoustics, unfortunately in a bad way. Breakfast lousy and not worth it at any price. Purchased an internet card at desk, failed to get a connection and was reimbursed. At price the Cambridge charges, and unable to deliver an internet access makes this a Hotel that can't be recommended. Car to airport at fair rate, but it stopped on the way and waited and waited to pick up more people. Staff was professional and they seemed to know they had a dud product on their hands. Anyone making their first (and only) trip to Sydney won't want to stay at the Cambridge.

Reviews.Title: “Base for Surry Hills nightlife!”
Reviews.Author: IntraVol
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for Sydney and Surry Hills nightlife. We booked last minute and the price was in thru average range. Think again if you want to use the carpark below as there are minimal spaces and its built like a coffin. Staff were friendly and the stay was plesent.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: JeremyL10036
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Cambridge from Dec 27, 2011. The staff were polite, friendly, helpful and did all they could to make the stay comfortable, but there are several elements beyond their control that make this hotel less than very good. Location wise, the hotel is in a superb location, and walking distance from the George Street shopping area and gorgeous harbour. The rooms are small and minimalistic which I expected given my experience here in the US with the American parent company Comfort Inn, but hoped for better given the price range. The elevators (or "lifts" in local lingo) are extremely slow and if the hotel is busy, which it was during my stay, then you're in for a bit of a wait. My rate included breakfast which is decent. The most annoying aspect is that the hotel charges plenty for Internet use, and the optimal deal for my 3 night stay was a week-long internet package that cost 40 AUD. This is the first hotel I've stayed at in this price range that didn't offer complimentary internet service. My problems started when I couldn't get a signal on any device from inside the room, and on the rare occasions that I could the signal was too weak and slow to get anything done. The only place I could get a decent signal was in the lobby, and although the helpful staff did their utmost to rectify the situation it was of no avail. So if you need to work or be online during your stay you should be aware of this issue. To their credit the hotel refunded my 40 AUD since I had to sign up for a separate hotspot service elsewhere. Another issue I had was that despite the "do not disturb" sign on the door, the personnel entered the room and woke my up from my jet lag-enduced slumber. I didn't notice who it was, but it wasn't the friendly female house maid I encountered later on that day. It was a male staffer who didn't even bother to apologize. Typically "do not disturb" means exactly that, and one would expect the staff to respect one's wish for privacy. The final problem I had was that when entering the hotel late at night the access key doesn't activate the door, nor does the alarm bell work. I had to pound the glass door before the night crew noticed me. But overall, the bad experiences are somewhat compensated by the wonderful and friendly staff. The reception crew are purely fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Professional, Friendly Cambridge”
Reviews.Author: mark r
Reviews.Content: Sarah, Samantha, Andrew, Ledia, Evelyn, Mark, Dona and Lee Thompson were all professional, polite, friendly, employees who made my stay enjoyable. Even the maids were delightful. Sarah helped me at the desk nicely. Mark helped me with my room safe, while being friendly at the desk. None of the staff complains. They are helpful, while trying to anticipate my needs. Manager Lee Thompson was supportive of his staff, in addition to being very professional. Ledia was friendly, affirming, and charming. Andrew was friendly.Dona helped me the most, although I couldn't remember her name for a while. Samantha was great at giving me information over the phone before I arrived. When you stay for more than a few nights, it's important to have friendly staff. I know the word! These people are CARING. That's it. The rooms are spacious. They are very tidy, clean, and enjoyable to sit in just to relax. TV works well, the air conditioning was great. What's not to like, AND a caring staff. (Yes, I said "caring" again.) The windows open to outside to get fresh air and feel the rain. The window is nice and large. I recommend this hotel. It is a nice short distance from CBD. They have a nice small pool that is clean. They even have an arrangement with a neighbor gym where folks can work out for FREE. Awesome. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Renee Y
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the Cambridge Hotel in September. The room was a little small but it was satisfactory. Our sliding door to the balcony wouldn't lock. We brought it to the attention to the assistant hotel manager and she took care of it and made sure that we were comfortable. It's located right next to the police station and I felt the area was a safe and secure place. Also a lot of food places nearby. The only downside was the location was a little far from Darling and Sydney Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Top spot in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: MegGibbo
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. Wonderful staff, location and facilities. Very good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Melissa S
Reviews.Content: After staying for many years in another hotel on the side of the city, when we moved offices I had to find a new hotel and Cambridge was the closest. First I would like to rave about the beds I've had - they are HUGELY more comfortable than the previous hotel! The rooms in general are very comfortable, the shower is a good size and all in all I'm very happy! They are close to Oxford Street but even staying on Level 2 there is not too much noises from the revellers outside even on a Saturday night. The staff are always very friendly and even arranged for me to have the Frequent Flyer points that I had missed when I made my booking. I'm pleased to recommend this hotel - I've now been five times and will be back again in March 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Really handy location”
Reviews.Author: scuba_diving_matt
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel to be in a handy location. I hate city traffic and I love staying at the Cambridge Hotel because I can drive my car straight to the hotel without having to push through the heart of the city ciaos and park in the hotel underground car park. STRESS FREE I TELL YOU!!!! I frequently visit Darling Harbour and Circular Quay and find the Cambridge Hotels rates to be better value than most hotels in the city. Why pay $100-$200 more to stay one street closer to the action when you can get better service, better quality and better all round deal just a $5-$10 cab charge from 90% of the action. Or walk if you want!!! If thatâ€™s what you prefer. It would be a 10-15 minute walk from most HARBOUR SIDE attractions for all those that want to burn off the huge breakfast that Cambridge serve up!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with some good rooms”
Reviews.Author: UselessJRPass
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in December. The hotel is in a side street off Oxford Street about a 15-20 minute walk to the City Centre. We arrived before the 2pm check in time on the first day and there was no room ready. As we had a show to go to, we were unable to go to our room at all, and waited until our return to check into the room. The hotel provided two pieces of cake for a $24 charge while we waited. On our return, after a lengthy wait we finally received our keys and after another lengthy wait due to the elevator not working we reached our room on the 9th floor. A very nice, modern, clean and spacious room with a balcony. Our room and balcony were overlooked by a huge block of apartments only a few metres away requiring us to close all curtains to avoid being watched by the apartments residents. The room offered absolutely no privacy due to the close neighbours. The TV had a mediocre picture, with clipped pictures on most channels and only a few of the free to air channels. During the Saturday night there was unbelievably loud music playing nearby waking us up at 3:30am. There are better rooms here, however the room we had may be better suited to backpackers or those not needing privacy. We were charged $50 for a 2pm checkout. Service at the counter was generally good, but rather slow at times. If staying here, be very careful about which room you stay in. 3 to 4 stars depending on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: BigMama460 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lee, Andy and the man on the front desk between 10am and 10.30am 3/12/11 offered fantastic service. Lee even went and stood in the middle of the road to get me a taxi late night. Room was clean but for nearly $400.00 per night (3 people) expected more than a bedroom and ensuite. The hotel was fully booked and even though we had to wait for room service late at night, it was delivered and the meal was enjoyed - to be fair lots of fans of Eminem arrived back at the hotel at the same time. Every meal we ordered was lovely and the price was reasonable. I asked for directions when leaving the hotel and a map was provided, advice on transport given, places to see recommended and never once felt hurried even though I wasn't the only one at reception. Customer service really matters to me and guarantees return custom. They will have mine mainly because of excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: Lanalosophy
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasing stay at the Cambridge Hotel on a Friday night for a girls night out. I was in a deluxe city view room, which was on the 9th floor. We had lovely views (even though the weather was abysmal!) A very comfortable bed and a good bathroom. Although shower was over the bathtub, which I don't particularly enjoy. We ordered room service and it was OK although they didn't have the olive mix I wanted. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too Basic”
Reviews.Author: Polly S
Reviews.Content: I had 2 stays in this hotel going in and out of Sydney. After the first stay I did try and swap to another hotel.....The rooms were clean but the furniture was tatty and the settees looked well worn and grubby. The continental breakfast was abysmal, tinned fruit,( you had to pay extra for fresh fruit,) thin ham, a choice of one cheese and not much else. It was so basic I didn't bother and went out to eat. A couple of the lads on the desk were helpful but otherwise I did not find the hotel particularly friendly.After a long haul and being tired they did nothing to hurry my room to be ready even though I asked if they could.The air conditioning was so loud you could not sleep with it on, in the bathroom the shower was practically hanging off the wall. Very little wardrobe space. Work men came to reset the safe in dirty overalls.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: Starshaped
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a pretty good location - you can walk to circular quay in about 30-40 minutes - or there are direct buses conveniently close by. Our room was very quiet and we slept well despite the jet lag. Breakfast was ok - nothing to rave about. The pool was disappointing - very small and freezing cold. The room was clean and adequately appointed. The bathroom was a little tired. The staff were very friendly however check in was disappointing. We arrived at 8am and I fully didn't expect to get my room at that time however it would have been nice to have been given it a little early. i think check out is 10.30 so find it hard to believe it took the cleaner 3.5 hours until 2pm to clean it and it seemed so much of a convenience that it was suddenly ready at 2pm on the dot. There were other people waiting and I think they felt the same. I am pregnant and had been travelling for 24 hrs so better customer service would have meant the room was cleaned and available much quicker.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: m_watson49
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week and was happy with the value given. Nice clean room although not much room to store clothes and only a shower. Reasonable breakfast . Very helpful staff . On 13th floor and could see top of Opera House. Reasonably close to transport and fairly central.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money: Sleep in the park next door.”
Reviews.Author: Katherine N
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't too bad; it's clean and has adequate food and the staff aren't too surly. But it had a number of failings that made my stay there just horrible. The bathroom was appalling. The shower screens didn't slide on their track, the sink was actually broken, and the soap dish in the shower wasn't attached properly and dumped everything in it onto the floor when you touched it. But the worst was the hot water. At any time of day, regardless of water pressure, the shower was impossible to adjust; first hot, then freezing cold. At one point I even found a setting where it would alternate between hot and cold every five or six seconds, without me touching the taps at all. At one point the water pressure was so low the hot water wouldn't work at all and all I had was a trickle of ice-cold water. But worst of all, my reservation was stuffed up and the staff were convinced I was leaving a day earlier than I was supposed to, despite taking a photocopy of my online reservation information. I had five different people in three hours try to enter my room to evict me, and four phone calls from reception. I shudder to think what would have happened if I wasn't in the room at the time. I spoke to reception a number of times, asking them to let the staff know, which didn't make a difference at all. Then after it had all been sorted out, my swipe card access to my room was revoked. The hotel's feedback page on their website also mysteriously crashes when you send feedback, and my email to them went unanswered. Sloppy work from the staff and maintenance, and the hotel's management obviously don't care. Freezing showers, no security and extremely noisy: you're better off sleeping in a park.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very helpful staff, accommodation excellent”
Reviews.Author: BristolDaisyMay
Reviews.Content: We had 10 days here in late October/early November. It should have been a week but then Qantas grounded their fleet so we had an extra 3 days. We were able to stay in the same room, there were three of us, Mum, Dad and daughter (in our 50's and 24) so we had a studio suite which meant a double room for us and a sofa bed in the living area for our daughter. Kitchen area very good. Kettle, toaster, crocks etc. Small fridge which was perfectly adequate and a microwave which we didn't use. The staff were all great and very helpful when the Qantas thing hit. There is a laundry down in the basement (we were travelling around Australia and needed to travel fairly light so washing facilities were essential) so you can either do your own (which we did) or the hotel will do it for you for a fee. We were on the 6th floor, overlooking the police station and the Porterhouse Hotel (an Irish pub - they do very good pub grub). We were within easy walking distance of the city, the parks, Circular Quay etc. We only used a taxi twice, getting from and to the airport, the rest of the time we walked or used public transport.

Reviews.Title: “A great value in the city”
Reviews.Author: Chezmay
Reviews.Content: I had two one-night stays here a week apart on my way in and out of Australia. The Cambridge made a great first impression when I arrived around 8:30 in the morning after an overnight flight to find that I could check into my room right away! My fellow travelers and I had been planning to drop off our bags and explore the city, but it was great to be able to shower and change first. Obviously they can't always do this, but it's nice to know they will let you in first thing in the morning if rooms are available. (Some more friends arriving an hour later weren't so lucky though; we'd taken the last available rooms until later in the day.) The two rooms I had were, clean, large, and modern, and they had a great skyline view. I don't know if these were upgraded from the standard room; I just took what my company booked for me. The room on my first stay had wifi available for a fee. The only drawback to this room was that I heard a lot of street noise and some yelling from a nearby pub around 2 am. On my second stay, the room didn't have wifi coverage and it overlooked the same pub. When I asked at the desk to move, they said they couldn't guarantee any particular room would have wifi, and in any case the rooms they had left were likely to be noisier. However, I didn't hear any loud noises that night. The staff also pointed out that wifi was always available (for the same fee) in the lobby. The location is two blocks off Oxford Street, which is a very lively clubbing district. As I said, there was some street noise, and you see a lot of young people out having fun in the evening (and sometimes the next morning), but I didn't feel that the neighborhood was threatening. There's a large police station right across the street. The train station is about 1 km away, down a hill. This was a easy walk for me with one suitcase. The main shopping areas and Hyde Park, along with any number of restaurants, are also in walking distance. The Circular Quay and the Opera House are farther, but my friends and I still made it on foot. You could also get there by tram or bus or taxi. All in all, I was happy with the Cambridge, and it was an excellent value for a nice hotel in a convenient location. Only the spotty wifi and some street noise keep me from giving it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Clinton07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok, but definitely 3 star, not the 4 that they claim. The location is perfect - very close to the city (10 minute walk to George Street or Darling Harbour) and about 1 minute to Oxford Street. The staff are also very friendly and efficient. I stayed in one of the larger rooms on the 11th floor which was very clean and functional. The bathroom was also very modern and extremely clean. The hotel has a minimalistic design which I liked, but it lacked the finishing touches that would really make it a 4 star property. The things that bring it down were the dirty, leaf-covered door matt on entry, the sign-cluttered reception desk (which goes against the modern minimialist design), the tacky lights on the stairs from the reception to the bar area, the breakfast was VERY average and poorly presented. A 4 star property would have significantly more options (more meats, cheeses, cereals, different breads, fruit and fruit salad, different yogurt options, a selection of pastries including croissants, danishes etc), but this one didn't! The Cambridge had a very simple cereal, toast and cooked breakfast (English style) that lacked imagination and creativity. I also opened the sliding door to my balcony and the handle fell off. The other issue was the very expensive internet - $20 per day is extortion and needs to be mentioned. It is about time that Sydney hotels caught up with the times and offered free internet like most of the rest of the world. If coffee shops and McDonald's can offer free internet then so should hotels! Overall, I might stay here again because I liked the location and the service, but it definitely needs to improve the finishing touches and step up to become a genuine 4 star because at the moment it isn't!

Reviews.Title: “Location of Cambridge very good”
Reviews.Author: PerthLuscious
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Cambridge Hotel and my stay was better than expected, I seriously was expecting the worse! It is a small compact well located hotel that offers standard service, clean rooms and reasonable room rates. For a short stay in Sydney it is worth a try. I am very familiar with the area and a walk down Albion Street to Central Railway is pleasant and not too far. Alternatively a walk to Museum or St James Stations via Oxford Street and Hyde Park is also a pleasant stroll. I didn't try the hotel cafe but there are plenty of places to eat on Oxford Street, including the Swiss Bakery for good coffee and pastries. A walk to the David Jones foodhall is also worth a visit for some food supplies.I was initially worried about the street noise however it wasn't a major problem. The hotel sits amongst many surrounding urban dwellings of Surry Hills however the noise levels weren't disturbing. If you have time take yourself for a stroll around the lovely tree-lined streets of Surry Hills, it really is a great inner-city area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: gmar18
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a friends birthday and stayed here for the wk end with a girl friend - we picked the hotel based on location and price and we were very happy. The location was fantastic as we could walk into the city, as well as walk and explore the Surry Hills, Paddington area including all the shops and cafes/restaurants. We were meeting friends for drinks in Paddington so this was perfect. The room was clean and with two double beds which was perfect for us. The bathroom was exceptionally clean which was our main thing. Given the price and location, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “girl's night in town”
Reviews.Author: narelleh
Reviews.Content: a girlfriend and i stayed one night for a "girl's night in town". Very convenient location, if you want to enjoy the sights and sounds of Darlinghurst/Paddington. Close to lots of restaurants (and night clubs if that's your thing) but not noisy. A very comfortable room - we had a twin which was 2 double beds - not a big room but certainly adequate. We didn't use any of the facilities. But can vouch for the friendly, helpful nature of the staf..

Reviews.Title: “spotless,handy and elegant”
Reviews.Author: bryanboy
Reviews.Content: stayed one night and found this to be a very pleasant secure hotel.The staff could not have been more helpful and efficient. As this is our second visit we will definitely return again.The pool was as described in the hotel,s brochure. Breakfast was delivered to the room on time and was delicious.The staff were helpful with getting extra towels and arranging for a taxi to the airport.the foyer area is very roomy and quite comfortable while waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in an awesome location!!”
Reviews.Author: Rubixx
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to Sydney for my birthday weekend. This hotel is located off the main road in Surry Hills, New South Wales. The facilities were clean and tidy. Issues we had was the noise from pool users. The pool is located in the middle of the hotel. If you want a quiet room, request for a room that is away from the pool. There is carparking facilities, 5 levels in fact. They are underground with about 3 spots per level. If you have a big car you might have a bit of trouble driving down the tight carpark and parking your car. There are two elevators in the hotel and during peak times they take some time to arrive. The best part of the hotel is its location. In just a short walk you can dine at Bills (Bill Granger's) Restaurant and Billy Kwong (Kylie Kwong's) Restaurant. For those who do not know they are Australian celebrity chefs. Also, there are plenty of pubs and nighclubs nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: RogueAmbassador
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and it is still a great place to stay in Sydney. Check-in was fast even tho the young lady was under training. Staff went out of their way to be very helpful and courtious. Rooms were very well appointed and very clean. Breakfast was superb as always. This hotel is well worth recomending to friends. Will stay every time I am in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “very helpfull”
Reviews.Author: Russell G
Reviews.Content: recently stayed here and have to say it was a very nice stay, we had a double room and it was in very good condition and so was the en-suite. staff were very helpfull and polite, nice little touch one day as we had left our do not disturb sign up by accident so they could not clean the room so they left a bag with clean towels and toileteries and a letter explaining why they didn't clean up. only complaint was that we got woken up by accident by reception early one morning, but when we complained they were very apolgetic and comped us a breakfast for nothing. also its location is excellent being within walking distance of most sites plus 5 mins from a lively part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been more helpful”
Reviews.Author: Darrylwarren
Reviews.Content: From the get go the staff were amazing and had a genuine concern that their guest were happy and wanted for nothing. A big city can be daunting but they managed to break it down into bitesize prices . A special thank you to all the day staff and the staff member who arranged a car to the opera at such short notice .

Reviews.Title: “Good value and large lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Laura S
Reviews.Content: Large room, great bed with all the latest mod-cons. Most Sydney hotels in the mid-range offer cramped rooms with faded interiors. The staff was attentive and friendly. The location was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Kensington25
Reviews.Content: I booked this place for two weeks on lastminute.com becaus of its central location and great price. I used to live opposite it when I lived in Sydney but had never been in. I was not sure what to expect but it most certainly exceeded my expectations. The staff were really friendly and my room huge with a separate area for seating and watching television. The bathroom was a good size too with a bath. I had breakfast in the hotel a couple of times and the muesli was to die for. Delicious. Best I have had. I usually do not sleep very well but my bed was very comfortable and my room had no outside noise. I had the perfect night's sleep every evening. The location is perfect too. Very central and close to all the night life. I really struggle to make any criticisms. The only one I can make is that staff forgot to give me my wake up call on my final morning before my flight. Thankfully I had set my alarm. Beyond that I cannot fault this wonderful hotel. I will not hesitate to stay there again on my next trip to Sydney. Excellent value for money, spacious, great staff, fantastic night's sleep and a superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in town.”
Reviews.Author: George Q
Reviews.Content: Over the past 20 years I have stayed at the Cambridge more times than I care to remember it's value for money, location perfect, 5 minutes to the bus stop if you want to go into the CBD or walk it in 15 minutes. The rooms are always clean everything you want is there, breakfast just as good as what you would get at home. Once you are in the system which is the same as any property all you do is ring no charge untill you get there or leave. I think you can tell wether it works or not by the staff being there for long periods of time they are friendly and have always found them helpful and eager to please. For where it is and the price it would be very hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “A great location to stay so close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Helen L
Reviews.Content: First trip to Sydney and my family and I had a great time. Only there a very short time (to watch the football), but it is so central to the city, Sydney harbour and of course the football stadium. The room was extremely clean as there were 4 of us. Great reception staff,its a shame we could not stay longer. Throughly recommend if you want a great location to stay while in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Way back here”
Reviews.Author: DeWittHouston
Reviews.Content: Must say staff at this facility are absolutely helpful but can't say the same for my room. Although quite spacious for a double, it was way in the back near the pool. This would not have been too bad if it did not seem so isolated for a single female. I did feel uncomfortable asked to move and informed I could not as purchased my ticket via Booking.com. Overall, the room had a small refrigerator and that was plus. Bathtub had mold around the tub so not a great sight when taking a shower. Location was actually very good although several gay bars nearby but made the area more interesting. If you walk out of the hotel, turn right about 5 min walk to buses etc. on Oxford. There is a nice grocery store only a few feet from the hotel which was perfect. If you have a car great but parking expensive if not hop on a bus 333 from oxford and head to Bondi Beach the 333 is the express bus. You can also take any of the buses into Circle Quay which takes you Sydney Opera House or take nice walk through park to Opera House. You are less than 5 mins from the museum, in fact, it is next to the Marriott off of Oxford street. If you have limited dollars, you really can't go wrong with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: PDunni
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a few times and have been happy every time. I stayed in a deluxe balcony room for the 1st time and was very pleased. Excellent staff on the desk and they maintain their Facebook for feedback and comments. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Oxford St clubs and shopping”
Reviews.Author: J79guy
Reviews.Content: 10 minute walk from central station (although it's up hill). Very well located for Oxford street clubs and shopping, but far enough away from the main street to be quiet! Recommended for anyone wanting weekend of partying at the clubs or shopping along Oxford Street. Pick a weekend with great weather and you can walk everywhere. The hotel is about a $9 taxi fare from George street main shopping precinct. Being right next to a police station it feels very secure. Rooms are a very large size. Bathrooms slightly pokey but the curtains are total blackout so if you want a sleep in, it is easily achieved. The hotel is staffed by friendly staff who are gay friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't have a good stay here.”
Reviews.Author: BobaPhil
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself, at first glance, seems nice, with a warm atmosphere. The check was simple. Then you have to work out the lifts. They are all on different walls, facing different directions. One of them only goes to floor 2, the other two go to the top. We were on the first floor, at the end of the â€˜rats mazeâ€™ of a corridor. It was very confusing. The room was a good size though, the bath room was good. There was a small TV, located the other end of where the bed was, it was too small really, for where it was. The main problem here was the noise. If a another guest on the floor let the door slam, it could be heard throughout the floor. We were woken up, several times, but guests coming in and letting the door shut loudly. Also, we had a noise on the two nights we were there, that woke us up, once at 1am and then at 3am the next night! It sounded like someone scrapping a chair along a titled floor. It went on for about 30 minutes, intermittently, the first night and we had to call the night porter up to get him to do something about it...which he didnâ€™t. The next night, it went on for about an hour, again, the night porter couldnâ€™t seem to figure out where it was coming from or how to stop it. The internet access, in our room, couldnâ€™t be accessed. When I did go to the lobby to Skype friends and family, I paid for 30 mins/30 mgb of access. I logged in, called home and checked some web sights...8 minutes later I was cut off. I have used up my 30mgb of data and would have to pay again! I complained to the staff, who put me on the phone to the company that provide the wireless access, only to be told there was nothing I could do! It was a complete rip off...ended up having to go to the internet cafe across the street, for a much better rate! Also, the location of the hotel, the main street had gay bars and night clubs. PROS : Clean room. Good shower. CONS : Noise levels! Size and location of the TV. Far from anywhere. The internet was a rip off. I wouldnâ€™t want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked it - I'll remember it for next time!”
Reviews.Author: MissAJ936
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in Sydney for a shopping weekend and this hotel really helped me have a great experience. Its walking distance from the boutiques on Oxford St, as well as an easy walk to Pitt St mall and the rest of the city. I'm a young, single female traveller and I can confidently say I always felt safe, and didn't find it noisy despite being the weekend. The staff were friendly, my twin room was clean and well appointed and I have not got any complaints. I would not recommend the hotel to travelers looking for ambience or character (it is good but not outstanding) but aside from that I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A decent Hotel - but let's not get too excited”
Reviews.Author: JudeDudes
Reviews.Content: Having read many posts on this hotel I hear one recurring theme: "great value for the centre of Sydney." Well, yes, I agree in the main, you won't find much better, but let's not massage our reviews based upon that theme alone - let's be pragmatic - hotel quality should be able to be rated in isolation from location, and therein treated on merit. My review will filter through and present a pragmatic look at the hotel. It is indeed a decent hotel. The rooms are of a good standard - they are not 5 star, but they are clean, pretty modern and well organised. But the TVs, whilst LCD, have poor reception - I have stayed here on three trips to date and on each occasion, in different rooms, the TV reception is appalling. I am not sure why this is the case - they are running FOXTEL through what appears to be an anologue link or something (OK, my tech facts are wrong but bottom line you get my point - poor TV reception!). They don't have free Internet - helloooo? It's 2011! Don't use some poor excuse along the lines of "...well Sir, you won't find many other hotels in Sydney who do offer free Internet..." Rubbish! Get ahead of the game, fork out, be a business leader and offer it free for your guests like just about anywhere else in the modern world, don't be so darn stingy! You want international business - give free WiFi rather than a poor option of a third party supplier who charges like a wounded bull!! Don't insult us please. The lobby is a bit of a mish-mash. Depending on what time you arrive you can be waiting for a long time or a really long time. There's a cast of internationals running the desk who generally are pretty good, but the system they are using (whatever it is) is slow. Average check-in is 5-10 minutes (from my three stays, arriving at different times of the day). Most of my standard business hotels can get me a room key and away in under 3 minutes. That's the benchmark for good service that I use and there should be no reason a good receptionist can't deliver it. There is some bizarre ritual of chargin a $1 holding fee or something?? Come on guys, sort that rubbish out. You're the only hotel who has ever done that to me. Take a credit card swipe for goodness sake. But overall I do like staying here because the staff are also friendly and accommodating and the rooms are good and well organised for business overnight stays (the last stay my room window had a view directly to a solid brick wall 2 metres away! Would have been depressing if I was spending any time in my room during the day!). Parking is expensive, but I will concede this one - it is close to CBD Sydney, so it WILL be expensive. For now, you will get my business again Cambridge, but I would like to see some additional service offered if you are going to get better than 3 our of five stars from me. Hard rater perhaps, but undoubtedly fair, pragmatic and true!

Reviews.Title: “Misrepresentation at it's finest”
Reviews.Author: 100daysayr
Reviews.Content: After booking online we check in to find we have two single beds. At no point in our booking before payment did the site say single beds. After speaking to the Manager she was unable to change the booking claiming they were sold out BUT still online it showed you can make bookings. After a lengthy discussion and showing that the site does not say single beds she would not offer breakfast or vouchers saying it was not the hotels site, BUT the hotel appointed www.needitnow.com.au to handle their online booking meaning they trusted them to represent them. While hotels want Internet business they do not want to stand behind the sites. Find a hotel who will deliver what you pay for and don't hide or blame other people.

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: chad b
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located just on the city fringe which suited me. The rooms are very clean and the price is right. I booked on their own website and it saved me a few $$. Didn't try dinner but breakfast was good. The service and smiles from the check in staff is something i have not experienced in a hotel since the 60s. They even remembered my name as i walked by on the 3rd day. They have won business and word of mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brad b
Reviews.Content: Its would be hard to find another hotel like this in Sydney, The rooms (premium w/balcony) are spacious and affordable, the hotel is in a excellent location, (10 minutes CBD) and the front desk staff are the best i have come across in a long time. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Excellent

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aaron c
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few weeks ago for 3 nights. The room I booked was exactly what it was "Deluxe City View" The room was massive in comparison to some of the 5 star hotels i have stayed in. City views amazing at night. The room was probably the cleanest i have ever stayed in. The reception staff are brilliant. Sarah the Manager on at the time ensured a swift check in with a cheeky smile. The surrounding area especially crown st is the place to head for diner. 7 minutes walk into the city (timed) Better that any city hotel, the prices are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, OK for a short stay, good value but nothing flash”
Reviews.Author: brisgooner
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights for a typical conference stay in Sydney. Location is good for Surry Hills and the City centre. The hotel was just a place to sleep and leave luggage in central location, so wasn't after anything too expensive or with any high class amenities. I got pretty much what I paid for. The hotel is basic, good value and low frills. Room was a decent size, bed was pretty comfy and the shower worked. Nothing much else needed and nothing much else available anyway. Fittings were not great quality, the last refurb looked like it must have been a while ago. The shower door was a bit cranky and some of the fittings a bit bashed and loose. But it was reasonably clean and fairly well maintained otherwise. I'd stay there again for business if it was just a place to crash, but wouldn't want to stay for a holiday or with family or kids. It's just a bit too dark and dingy to make you want to spend any time in the room more than you have to. Staff were OK generally friendly despite being busy. I believe this chain can on occasion make a bit of a song and dance about not having photo ID if you book via a website, but didn't on this occasion for me. So thanks for that.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: derek1208
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay--the hotel itself is nice and clean with nice accomodations--but what really sets it apart was the staff. Evelyn was incredibly helpful at the desk--making getting around Sydney and seeing the sights very easy. All of the staff made my stay there most welcome--I'd definitely stay there again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Alen_Riverside
Reviews.Content: Our stay there was quite pleasant . Location: In heart of surry Hills where all the joyful events happen . Lobby and reception areas were some how small but cozy. We didn't use room service and restaurant. Reception staff were brilliant. Room was so clean and tidy and house cleaning service was done daily with care . Air condition system was a blessing in cold August nights.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back ASAP !!”
Reviews.Author: johnnieleo
Reviews.Content: I had a Four night stay one night in a premium room and the other 3 night in the spa room. Staff were friendly and accommodating ... i arrived early before check in and left my bags to have a look around the site , room was ready well before check in time and first room was great everything i needed and quite... not even 100 mtrs from oxford st .. and about a 15 min walk to paddys markets... buffet breakfast was handy .. full buffet for a great price .. Next 3 nights were in a spa room .. was fantastic large from with separate spa and still its own bath and shower ! .. i left the Do not disturb sign for the 3 nights and each day they left clean towels next to my door which is a service i have never seen before ... was fantastic i was never bothered and a free paper everyday too ... Cant wait to come back again .. and have a wonderful. relaxing time again ..

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: MelGeelong
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a two night stay in Sydney. The room booked was a cheaper deal "Atrium Room" and we found the room clean and well stocked. The hotel runs a great breakfast deal $9.50 for all you can eat continental or $14.95 all you can eat cooked, one of the best priced breakfast deals I have come across. We utilised the restuarant and room service on a couple of occasions finding the price and quality very good. Service provided by the staff was good. The only gripe I had with our stay here was the heated pool and spa were not so heated. The pool was a reasonable temperature for kids swimming and moving around but the spa was too cold to sit and relax in, think I lasted all of a minute. The hotel is located a few minutes walk from a main train station. A supermarket is located across the road and an abundance of restuarants are located nearby.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is - no fuss, clean, modern, comfortable, good value”
Reviews.Author: Turkeyjay
Reviews.Content: Located in Surrey Hills, this hotel is good value and does what it promises on the website - provides clean, modern and comfortable rooms. Service was friendly and helpful. The restaurant was a disappointment but there are plenty of nearby eating options. Overall it is very good value for money and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect - staff very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: George C
