Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel a day early. I wasn't aware of that (my time zones and days were all screwed up after arriving from the U.S.). Highest marks to Lee, the evening manager for getting everything straightened out for us. The staff were very accommodating in finding a room for my family and me. And then they let us remain in that room the duration of the stay. I'm not sure if this room was what we had reserved. It seemed a little nicer than that for which we had paid, but it worked out perfectly. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. They seemed to really go out of their way to make our stay pleasant. Now, I have to say that everyone in Australia - even Sydney - seemed this way. However, the folks at the Quality Cambridge seemed like they were trying to go above and beyond the call of duty. Highest marks to them, as well. There is a bit of road noise on the lower floors (we were on the Fifth floor), but being in the City Center was well worth it. The walk to the Museum train station is not too far, and frankly gives one a nice taste of Sydney. The restaurant attached to the hotel was good. The prices were high, but all the prices were high in Sydney. (Americans beware: the Dollar just sucks in Australia right now - 2011). Highest marks to this hotel. And if they ever read this, highest thanks to the staff for making such a pleasant stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay....”
Reviews.Author: gemini_lou20
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here on our first trip to Sydney, as a shortstay/stop over to New Zealand, we stayed here from the 6th - 10th December 2011. The hotel itself was very easy to find... not too far from the airport. and is within walking distance from the centre of town..... as it was Christmas time... the town centre was very festive at night, when you could see all the lights switched on.... and what an amazing Christmas tree they put up.... beautiful... it took a while to get used to the temperature difference having travelled from Northern Ireland.... when we arrived in Sydney it was so hot..... the hotel was a good walk to the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Animal Wildlife Parks etc etc.... and you are able to take in some wonderful garden parks on the way.... everything was so easy to get to from here....lots to see and do..... shops are all within a short walking distance.... we found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful and when we had difficulty due to our tour operator getting transfers back to airport, they quickly got this sorted for us.... the hotels hospitality was wonderful.... would definately recommend.... would love to be back again to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful People, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelly L
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last week with my friends after a long & tiring night outs. People from front office to housekeeping were fantastic. Although I don't care much about the service, I must say it was all professional. Night room service was super quick. Loved the food. Yummmmmmmmm

Reviews.Title: “Many Great stays!”
Reviews.Author: Barty4740
Reviews.Content: I must stay I have not been a contributor to the Tripadvisor but have been an avid follower as I find the reviews to be very helpful in selecting hotels as I travel a lot to Sydney and around Australia. This time I thought I would share the experiences that I have Â had at the Cambridge hotel over the last few months as I have read many different opinions. During my stays I have stayed in many room types at the Cambridge hotel if you are after a economical room.(Sydney can be very expensive especially on the weekends) go for the pool atrium rooms. As on their website these rooms are really "no fuss" clean, comfortable and spacious with all the amenities that you need in a hotel room by Sydney standards. I have also stayed in their Premium rooms and Deluxe rooms. These rooms also offer great value for money. A tip if you are going to book ask for the rooms at the back of the hotel as the front facing rooms having great views of the Sydney city can suffer from street noise. The staff I have found to be excellent and obliging and always very helpful with all my requests and queries no matter how difficult they have been. I do not want to name any particular staff as I have found all staff front desk, housekeeping to be all excellent. I have now downloaded the Tripadvisor widget on my phone and intend not to be a bystander and share my experiences in the future with the Tripadvisor community. I highly recommend Cambridge hotel as a hotel that offers great value for money with excellent service. The location also has numerous bars, cafes, restaurant catering for all cuisines and budget Â  within walking distance. Be mindful that if you are going to book the Cambridge is mid range good value money hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, hotel about profit not quality.”
Reviews.Author: Weddinghunter
Reviews.Content: To start off the staff in this hotel are lovely and will go out of their way to help you. Thats the good bit! The bad bits: No free water Rattly air con, held together with duct tap. Noisy windows. Would we stay here again? No!! Needs updating, hotel pictures not true to hotel! Scrambled egg tastes like fake egg

Reviews.Title: “very good adress in a metropolis”
Reviews.Author: thomas r
Reviews.Content: very friendly and helpful people. The rooms are large, good equipped and clean.The breakfast is great. Just perfect for a good start in the day. It is good located, because it is close to the city and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best service in a long time...”
Reviews.Author: buster211
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner come to Sydney on a regular basis and this was our first time at the Cambridge hotel, and we had a wonderful stay. The service at reception was great, all the staff were so friendly and polite and we felt so welcomed as soon as we got through the doors. We got a free upgrade and the room was lovely, with a balcony overlooking Riley Street and a spacious room with everything we needed. We definitely got more than our moneys worth. Will be recommending this hotel in the future and returning very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Last resort”
Reviews.Author: bedoiunfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as the place we had been staying in was full and couldn't find anywhere else. I like the location and have stayed in other places in surrey hills but this place is more like a hostel than a hotel. Very basic rooms, tiny corridors and lift - everything feels very institutional! Was very clean though.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of the strip, had everything without the price or attitude.”
Reviews.Author: SeanMcIntosh
Reviews.Content: I found the Cambridge on Wotif.com. I was planning a weekend in Sydney for a birthday celebration on last weekend in July. Wotif is a great resource for those motivated by price, as I was. I have booked "mystery" deals before and have not had a problem. My booking with the team @ the Cambridge was not a "mystery". I have to say for the price I paid and the level of service / accommodation / parking and overall needs, the Cambridge would have to have been the best. I'm not one for the fancy bells and whistles hotels, they usually carry a price and attitude. If you want pleasant staff, clean well maintained accommodation and close to the CBD and Eastern Suburbs of Sydney look no further than the Cambridge. I've travelled and stayed at many hotels over the years, I have never bothered with writing a review or offering feedback. I felt compelled to share my views about the Cambridge. Simple, no fuss, clean, positioned hotel with very polite and well present team members. This all makes for a wonderful stay. (PS I stayed when a fire alarm went off, no drama's not carry on, professional well spoken team) Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Sue M
Reviews.Content: Good location - walkable distance into City Centre. Close to shops and excellent restaurants. Staff were very helpful. Rooms were clean and tidy - comfortable bed which is essential!!

Reviews.Title: “top notch”
Reviews.Author: Saltemister
Reviews.Content: This hotel was my last stop of a business trip in Sydney , the rooms are well appointed , spacious , clean and affordable. After reading the last few reviews I'm a little shocked that none of these experiences were encountered on my trip, just goes to show that positive thinking leads to great results. The staff are happy and well informed, hotel location is a very casual walk to Sydney city and I enjoyed room service on the final day. Highly recommended !!!

Reviews.Title: “Professional, friendly Hotel staffs & good price!”
Reviews.Author: HuanLuo
Reviews.Content: Location is in CBD, good price, most important thing is they got professional, friendly Hotel staffs! Will go there again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: laculturevulture
Reviews.Content: stayed july 30 through aug 2. Great hotel. room 909 was spacious with updated bathroom. Refrig and teapot in room. Wonderful friendly and knowledgable staff. Can walk to most tourist attractions. Also near bus/train station. room was clean, mattress was great.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings!”
Reviews.Author: Pkpm
Reviews.Content: Arrived late and was given room 801 for family of 4, 2 adults 2 children. If it hadn't been so late we would have complained that night. Wind was howling round the windows, into the bathroom through the ventilation vent and with the door between the rooms closed there was a gale blowing under the door. Noisy and cold. Asked for a different room and spent another 3 nights there. Much better. Staff were helpful. This is a basic hotel in a fairly noisy location but only 15 minutes walk from Darling Harbour. Hot water is excessively hot with no temperature control on the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Worst manager (SuRaj), poor service”
Reviews.Author: OzTrip8
Reviews.Content: This manager who has absolutely no idea on how to communicate or relay necessary information is not fit to be managing the front desk. His customer service or shall I say lack of understanding is the most shocking service I have ever experienced. I have stayed in many hotels in Sydney and have never come across such an inexperienced guy whose attitude was â€˜you deal with your problemâ€™. This guy keeps on asking the meaning of what is being said â€œmeansâ€� â€œwhat do you wantâ€�. I donâ€™t think he can handle a serious emergency situation as he could not provide any info on first aid at that time of the night due to his poor communication skills. The bloke needs to be trained up in resuscitation and other emergency procedures before itâ€™s too late. It is beyond me how he can be appointed as a manager. If you want a caring and professional service go somewhere else, if it is a cheap deal then it is ok but avoid dealing with the overnight staff as they will ask you to go outside the hotel in this weather and catch your own taxi. They canâ€™t be bothered. Itâ€™s too difficult for them to be booking a taxi for you. Worst service in Sydney if not Australia. Would never stay at this hotel again even if I was offered a free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwignome
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very safe its across the road from Sydney police centre. I found the staff very friendly especially the barman as I sat back watching TV own my own after a long day in the city.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is brilliant, brilliant in services ,brilliant in location economic.”
Reviews.Author: Goldrabbit
Reviews.Content: The environment in the hotel is so welcoming front desk staff were amazing so were the other staff. Hotel services were just perfect. Perfect hotel for the people who likes 5 star standard nd services.

Reviews.Title: “Very average accommodation, will not be heading back.”
Reviews.Author: janejohnson1983
Reviews.Content: Considering both the price charged as well as the numerous awards won by the hotel, we had relatively high expectations of the Quality Cambridge Sydney. Unfortunately none of our expectations were met, instead we came away disappointed in the front of house service and cleanliness of the rather dated room. On the first night at the Cambridge, much to our disgust, my boyfriend discovered brown stains all over the dona cover and sheets. These stains had been party hidden by a covering sheet, however they didn't take long to surface. This was enough to put us both off sleeping in the bed! Great location but very average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: alex6203Sydney
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting a 4star hotel you will be disappointed.If you are a size 10 woman or medium man you will just be able to get in the shower.A few spiders here and there the safe doesn't work and parking is expensive and very dangerous as it is very tight.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value - excellent service, what's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: daysleep2
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for 2 adults and 2 children for a few days at the end of a 3 week trip to Australia to see family and friends. It was by far the most reasonable option for our stay, similar apartment hotels we had stayed at in the past were significantly more expensive and we found the staff much more helpful at the Cambridge than places we had stayed before. The 1 bedroom apartment was spotlessly clean and tidied every day - the cleaners even did our washing up - which we didn't expect! Can't fault the service in any way - they left me messages for telephone calls I missed and a broken door handle was repaired within a couple of hours. But possibly the best bit for kids is the swimming pool - such a bonus! Hotel is also located close to shops and restaurantsand a short walk from Hyde Park and a nearby train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and OK rooms for the price but better suited to couples and singles than families”
Reviews.Author: ArchMcK
Reviews.Content: As we had two adults and three little children, we requested and were hoping for adjoining rooms but when arrived found that our rooms were on two different floors and the hotel does not have adjoining rooms. Not a good young family setup. Also, we arrived early and exhausted after a 28 hour international trip hoping for early check in which was not granted. Also, we were told that we reserved "premium" rooms with couches but no couches were present. All in all, everything was fine but not a very family friendly hotel. Probably better served for couples or singles.

Reviews.Title: “Lively central location, good value, modern and clean.”
Reviews.Author: scash80
Reviews.Content: This was just a short walk to the Sydney CBD and right next to Oxford road. My room had a good city view, was large, modern (great TV, large bathroom, and big sofa), and very clean. I was very pleased and it was good value, and when I return to Sydney again I will certainly consider returning here. Only annoying thing was a large fan outside the window which made a big noise during the night!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous News!”
Reviews.Author: FabulousNews
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated my birthday in Sydney and we stayed at the Quality Hotel Cambridge. We've stayed several times before but this visit something was different. Bed spreads were new, staff were more egar to help and they changed the dinning options. But the best part was when I found out that Richard is the new Front Office Manager! A personal congratulations Richard, that is fabulous news! You deserve it and the hotel's bar has just been raised! Your standards are honest, high and they are very lucky to have you. Looking forward to our next stay with you! Mr and Mrs Davis

Reviews.Title: “Great price, service, location. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Shidoran
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a premium twin double room on level 7 on a Tuesday night. With this Hotel, you must keep it in perspective in terms of value for money. The room was only $115 a night, which is really at the "budget" end of the accommodation scale. We thought that for what we got was pretty good value. The service was good (I found the staff helpful and very professional) the room was clean and had all the facilities we needed (We have 2 young children). It exceeded my expectations a little because I have stayed in more expensive hotels with less impressive facilities. We really liked the beds, they are on the firmer side (which I prefer so I found them particularly comfortable). The location is very good, you're a block away from a large shopping strip in Surry Hills and you can walk to central station in about 15 minutes. I didn't find the area particularly noisy, it's what you'd expect for an inner-city suburb a stone's throw away from a main road. Overall we would happily stay again if we need to be in the area. With all that said, there was a couple of things that I didn't like. It won't put me off staying again but if you are a little pedantic these things may annoy you. Firstly the TV reception was average. I couldn't figure out why that was, the TV itself and connection to the plug was fine, it may have been the wind messing with the aerial. The next thing was that one of the shower screen roller wheels was broken. I could still use the shower, but you'd think maintenance or housekeeping would pick something like that up pretty quick and have it fixed. It would have been a 5 minute job to do so. The next thing was that getting to the car park was annoying, you could use elevators to get down there, but you can't directly use the suites elevators from the car park! You have to go up to the ground floor in another elevator, then switch back to the suites elevator. After a couple of trips for nappies and things it was a bit annoying. The last thing was parking. Hotels that do this irk me because if you're staying in the hotel you should get free parking. Raising all the rooms by $5-$10 probably won't put people off staying if you offer free parking, but if you have a car, a room at this place is now worth $137 per night. That's not so price competitive if you don't need to be in Surry Hills, maybe the hotel needs to think about that one.... You can always find fault if you look for it but we think that ultimately this place is worth a look as it is relatively good value and in close proximity to the main CBD.

Reviews.Title: “very nice rooms, friendly staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Juli808
Reviews.Content: we were unsatisfied with this other hotel we were in and so we looked online and were very happy to stumble upon this hotel. Very nice and clean rooms, friendly and VERY helpful staff at the front desk and great location. we appreciated the radio that charged and played our itouch. I especially appreciate the kind, genuine and helpful service from front desk receptionists Evelyn, Ashleigh and Lee. They left a great impression on me, whenever I had a question they had answers, if they didn't know the answer, they went the extra mile to research and find out the answers for me. This made our trip run very smoothly and more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location and recommended for your stay in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: DazPerth
Reviews.Content: A truly pleasurable experience at this fine hotel. I researched prices and locations for many hotels, and I am so pleased I finally decided on the Cambridge Hotel on Riley St. I saw the locations and exteriors of many of the hotels I could have stayed in, and was pleased that I picked this one. The location is excellent. From the Airport you can get on the shuttle bus, or even taxi (for the same price as the shuttle at $25). Check in was pleasant, and the reception staff are always willing to offer assistance. The room was very adequate, clean and reasonably modern for Sydney. Some Foxtel channels are offered. The location two streets back from the lower end (City side) of Oxford st means you are close to walk to the City, Opera house, Kings Cross, Darling Harbour, and Darlinghurst (for shopping). Their is a Convenience store 5 mins walk from the hotel, many restaurants around the surrounding streets of the Cambridge and a fantastic internet cafe. Although I understand their was internet available in the hotel lobby, but I did not check its prices, as I was very happy with the Cafe close by. The Hotel does have a restaurant, which I tried for dinner, and it was good. Never tried the breakfast. Overall, a pleasant hotel, with friendly staff, and a great location to boot. Only downside was Housekeeping leaving all the dirty linen (Packed in bags) outside the rooms, but not a major issue. I will without a doubt stay here again on my next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed emotions over the Cambridge”
Reviews.Author: H2osafety
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not in the greatest of locations but not the worst. Staff was very friendly, over-the-top helpful when asked, but service was average otherwise. Pricey for what we got for room: VERY small room; twin beds almost butted up against each other, refrigerator but no dresser/drawers. Great shower (wonderfully hot water), but bare of amenities standard to a 4-star hotel. Simply a clean room with beds, plus refrig and instant coffee. Pricey Internet, very small tv. Put up with noisy bar crowds at night. Short walk (lots of hills in this area) to get to metro line. We stayed 4 nights but probably would check out other options next time.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Scott_Fiona_Anjali
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for the past year and a half for 2 nights at a time about 3 months apart. It is just ok - the service people are friendly and helpful. The rooms are ok but the sliding doors on the balcony rooms really need replacing - the are old and in a poor state. The beds are fine although some pillows without lumps would be good. The problem with Sydney is that hotels are expensive and this one is reasonable. Pretty quiet rooms unless you are around the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Quality but affordable high-rise hotel in cityside location; hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: MichaelG77
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at The Cambridge at Christmas 2010 and had a good experience then so wanted to return. Both times I was there to visit a relative who was in Darlinghurst and then Redfern, so The Cambridge was well-located, in East Sydney between Darlinghurst and Surry Hills. It's just off the city end of Oxford Street so ideal for convenience shopping or if you are there for nightlife. For dining, Crown Street is only a couple of blocks away. The location is a decent walk from the nearest railway station (St James), especially with heavy luggage, but I imagine there are buses on Oxford, and taxis aren't hard to find. It's a pleasant stroll though Hyde Park into the city, or along Macquarie Street to the Opera House, and the hotel is a good base for exploring Sydney's eastern, inner-southern and inner-western suburbs. For those not familiar with Sydney, it's in a 'racy' but upmarket area and reasonably safe on the street. It's not 'cheap' (compared to hostels) but not overly expensive either, and it is I think worth the money if you want somewhere comfortable and central and are prepared to spend a bit. It would I think suit business travellers. My room at Easter was a Premium Queen Balcony, on an upper floor with very good views (see photos), but it was a bit pokier than the Deluxe Balcony I'd stayed in at Christmas which had similar views. The Premium Queen Balcony had a rather small bathroom and nowhere to put the electric jug (except on the floor next to the power point). By comparison, the Deluxe Balcony also had a small lounge area and an 'office' zone with a desk, which I didn't really need but gave the room a more spacious feel, and more importantly (for me) enough shelf space for said electric jug. Beds are comfortable and the rooms are well-appointed generally with tasteful decor. The balconies have low railings so care is required (not all rooms have balconies by the way)! The service was efficient and friendly but non-intrusive and low-key - the desk staff were responsive when I told them that I couldn't get the TV set in my room to work, and it was fixed when I got back that night. Beyond the reception area, the hotel as a whole was very quiet and I rarely encountered other guests except in the lifts which are phone box-sized (you'd be struggling to fit more than three people in with no luggage). All-up, good value with no serious drawbacks. Most of the other guests seemed to be families, fashionable types and international travellers (but not really 'backpackers' as such).

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: Papawillie56
Reviews.Content: Over priced, the breakfast is awful, location is not good. Best to bring your electrical adapter, they do not loan any but they will sell you one for $15.00 AU. Breakfast is $14.95 AU per person and is sub par. Location is not good at all, be prepared to do lots of walking. Rooms are cleaned with sub par furniture and small selections on TV. $20 AU daily for Internet. close to Oxford street witth fast foods but no quality eateries or shopping. Closest train station is Museum station. Best to buy tours at Visitor Center at Darling Harbour instead of internet, much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: saranypan
Reviews.Content: Surry Hills is definitely one of the nicer quieter area of Sydney yet within walking distance to everything. We walked everywhere and had no need of taxi at all. Close to 2 main stations - Central and Musuem stations. Plus their shuttle to airport is cheaper than public train. We bought a cheap last minute deal from expedia but got a great rooom, with a separate lounge area with a nice view over the city. Room was very clean, very clean bathroom and serviced well everyday. Reception staff were friendly and helpful with our questions. For the price we paid for a sydney hotel in CBD we thought we got a great deal. Only weird thing was that the tea/coffee stuff was kept in the wardrobe, odd but not a complaint. All round great experience and will definitely look to stay there again when we're in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: GrannyFranny60
Reviews.Content: I recently had 3 nights at Quality Hotel Cambridge with my adult daughter. The room was comfortable and spacious and the bathroom clean and spacious. The staff went to a lot of trouble to help me access the internet and were always cheerful and willing to go the extra mile. The location is excellent for the city and Paddington and boasts a very colourful community. Great fun and interesting times had there. Will stay there again (and I'm really fussy...).

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat close to Oxford St. watering holes”
Reviews.Author: PINELights
Reviews.Content: Superconveniently located if you do not care as much about CBD and rather spend late evenings at Oxford Street venues. Close walking distance to Oxford St., a good place to get your sleep after a late night out without having to look for a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location with a yummy breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: JoSydney
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the last few years with my partner and with friends. It is a great location very convenient to the CBD. The service and cleanliness is always great and they have also got a great breakfast selection. Overall I found it to be a very good hotel in terms of convenience to the city and service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and top location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: RPAPKPMP
Reviews.Content: Based just off Oxford Street this hotel is perfect for those who want to walk and explore Sydney. Hyde Park is 10 minutes away, Opera House 30 minutes and Darling Harbour 30 minutes. Arrived after an overnight train journey and the staff were fantastic. Got into our room early and great advice on things to do and where to go. Could not have been more helpful. Lovely room and spotlessly clean. Great stay, would come back again and recommend to anyone going to Sydney

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ScottandEmma06
Reviews.Content: If you want to be central to everything... This is the Hotel to stay in. You have everything at your doorstep. We have stayed here many times and each visit gets better and better. A quick walk through Hyde Park has you at the doors of all the major shops while at night you have the variety of food all the way along oxford street. If you want to pop ovr to Bondi it is less then $20 in a cab and to make it easier the cabs are only 100m away. Highly Recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel - don't stay. Stinks. Basic. Not for business.”
Reviews.Author: BlueBaboon
Reviews.Content: Rooms are really basic. Can get better value rooms at Sebel in Surry Hills. Similar price, slightly higher for what you pay.Room smell of urine. Service was ok. They tried their best. For back packers, ok. For leisure or business, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff, but this is just an oversized backpacker hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SnoopyChop
Reviews.Content: The wife and I just got back from our honeymoon in Australia. In Sydney we stayed at the Quality Hotel Cambridge. It was not a good idea. The hotel is in a nice location with plenty of bars/restaurants, and the staff are very nice. HOWEVER, all of the guests were backpackers who partied all throughout the night. If you are looking for a relaxing, peaceful stay in Sydney, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: BigFatBudgie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days whilst in Sydney. It was a disappointing experience - especially when you see the glossy website pictures. Room was drab, stain on the carpet with filthy windows. View overlooked lots of air conditioned units. Bar & breakfast area were soulless. Breakfast overpriced and overrated. Very noisy one night with a party going on. At best would be ok for unfussy business travellers, but I would not stay again even for free.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Not so Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: SteveWeller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for Oxford St and a short walk through Hyde Park for main street shopping. I booked 3 months in advance and probably got the worst 'Queen Premium' room on offer. Some of these rooms are at the back of the hotel and oddly shaped to accommodate the hotel stairs. On check in I noted the TV was faulty. After reporting it it took 24hrs to replace the TV. The room was also not serviced by 4pm next day. The worst thing about this hotel is that there is no service lift and between 8am-3pm it can take a very long time to get a lift due to housekeeping using the lifts. The rooms were clean and reasonably quiet but for the price could have got much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a nice neighbourhood!”
Reviews.Author: flyingstarz
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got to be the safest in Sydney - it's right beside the Sydney Police Station! Having said that, the hotel was nicely located and easily accessible to the city center with just around 10-15 mins walk. We were given a room upgrade upon check-in, which was nice as we had booked for 3 nights. We had a nice room with a balcony that overlooked the city area. We parked at the basement of the hotel. It was challenging due to the tight corners in the carpark so you got to really go dead slow if you are driving a big car. Do remember to request a multi-pass from the reception if you park there so that you can enter and exit any time. The staff were friendly and always available to help, and twice we had difficulty getting in and out of the carpark they were prompt in their assistance. There is a supermarket down the street where the hotel is located, which operates from 7am till midnight, making it very convenient to get any food or drinks. The hotel is also near to Oxford street with lots of fast food joints / restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineBistro
Reviews.Content: We walked from the station which was quite a way but a pleasant walk showing the area, and booked into the Quality cambridge. Staff were efficient, and friendly. Had a room only basis but a lovely place round the corner for breakfast and a couple of supermarkets. would stay again - price was right and accomodation roomy.

Reviews.Title: “She remembered my name !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 88Londoner
Reviews.Content: I last visited Sydney and stayed at the Cambridge Hotel late last year. I am back for 2 weeks with my partner this time for a mixture of business and leisure. On checking in, I was pleasantly surprised that the front office assistant manager remembered my name, which immediately gave me a warm and happy feeling after a long flight. We arrived early in the morning and was given an early check in to a very spacious room with city view. We had a fantastic stay and looking forward to return to the Cambridge. This hotel is one of our favourite hotels in the world. Thank you to all the staff at Cambridge...

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam2011_11
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. I have stayed here three times, in the past year, each visit was enjoyable. The staff is very friendly and helpfull at all times. The rooms are kept very clean. As a solo traveller I was happy that the hotel is located in a very safe area. There was never any problem taking walks to Darling Harbour and The Sydney Opera House, even after nightfall. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tracyong29
Reviews.Content: Very close to town, walking distance. Good for family.

Reviews.Title: “Our 4th trip back to this hotel - amazing value for money in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SR32
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel during Mardi Gras as it's location is second to none - only 200m from Oxford Street and all of the action and surrounded by a plethora of cafes and restaurants with the city a 10-15 minute walk. This was our 4th stay at this hotel and continue to come back for the comfortable rooms, friendly staff and fantastic vibe. You really can't go wrong staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: kab0406
Reviews.Content: Our premium balcony room was well worth the cost. It was spacious with a sitting area, freshly updated bath and furnishings. Our floor was quiet and there was even a peek of the Opera house at the end of the street. We liked the 15-minute walk to the train station and the botanic gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chewbacker888
Reviews.Content: Really like this place - the staff are awesome, except for the short round guy on the counter who can talk waaay too much! But all in all a fantastic experience! Right in the heart of everything, close to the city and restaurants. The PR people a really nice! Hey Rafa! The manager guy is sweet and looks after you really well! Hey Steve! Recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: ATMoore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quality Hotel Cambridge for 7 nights culminating in the Mardi Gras weekend. All of the hotel staff I dealt with were friendly, engaging, and very helpful with the many questions I asked, from how to use the bus system to where to find a post office. They never steered me wrong. The location was very good for both night life and sight seeing, and The room itself was spacious and very comfortable, and it was great to have a balcony. You could definitely hear the other doors on the hall opening and closing, but all in all I very much enjoyed my stay here. Thanks to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful friendly staff, willing to help in any way.”
Reviews.Author: cantrum
Reviews.Content: We were a demanding family with some special needs which the friendly staff at all times attempted to accomodate. They were patient and understanding, indeed typical of the folk we met in this friendly city. The hotel represents good value for money and is accessible to all the major attractions and the good public transport systems. We were able to book in early following our 15 hour flight and also continue to use the facilities after our check out time. Communication prior to arrival was prompt and efficient. The cabs that reception called for us were not particularly reliable and indeed on two occasions we had to provide the directions for the driver to our destination! We identified a good taxi service ourselves in the end. The staff were all so cheerful and gave the appearance of being interested in their clients - well done, as not always an easy job!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Chazzer22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what we needed - just a couple of nights to see the main sights of Sydney. Reasonable price compared to others in the area. I would recommend paying the exta for a renovated bathroom (some of my party had to move rooms due to the un-renovated rooms being grotty). Our room (10th floor) was large, clean and comfortable but still pretty loud at night despite the fact that the hotel is off the main streets. Building work right outside when we stayed which started early in the morning, also right next to the police station so sirens are heard even from 10th floor! Nice street off the main roads, felt safe, near to coffee shops, also quite near to the sex shops part of town if that bothers you! A good 30 min walk to Opera house / Bridge / Ferry wharfs - but if the weather is nice you can walk through the botanic gardens. About 20 mins walk from Darling Harbour which was a nice area for good restaurants / bars / nice shopping centre etc. 5 mins from the train station. I would certainly stay here again. One thing I would say is that we booked direct and had no issues, however, every time we passed reception there was guests there who had problems with their room bookings i.e. hotel saying they didn't have the bookings, guests expecting to stay for more nights but rooms not booked etc so don't know if these booked direct or via 3rd party agents so maybe just check before you arrive! Restaurant and pool on site which we didnt use so can't review.

Reviews.Title: “What I Really Thought”
Reviews.Author: Dobson-Shaw
Reviews.Content: We had travelled 27 hours from England to Australia and arrived at the hotel at 8.00am. From the outside I was disappointed. We agreed that check in was not officially until 2.00pm, but aksed if we could have an early check in, we were willing to pay an additional amount. At 12.00pm, after waiting four hours in reception, we asked if the room was now ready, we were told not but if we upgraded to another room, one was ready. This we agreed to out of sheer tiredness. We asked if this room had been ready all along and was told not, which left me to ask, if this room could be got ready, why could our original one not have? no explanation was given. On entering the room we were not disapointed as it was spacious and everything worked, but at an additional charge. The breakfast is very good, but the dining room sparse with plastic furniture. The evening meals are more then adequate, but plain, which actually suited us. The meals are the same price as dining out. One day we wanted to cash some travellers cheques, which they did, but charged us, this is the only hotel of all the four we have used in Australia that did this! Overall the hotel is ok, but I wouldn't like to leave my luggage in the luggage storage room as it is unattended and in the basement car park, which means any other guest with a card could take your bags and no one would be the wiser. We are due back in Sydney on the 20.03.11 and have not chosen to return to this hotel as for 50 dollars more, we got the Holiday Inn on The Rocks, which looks far better and as a great roof top swimming pool with views of the Opera House. Would I stay here again, unfotrtunately not in fact unless you are gay and want access to the gay area, not sure why you would choose this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: TheLynch
Reviews.Content: Quality Hotel Cambridge was everything you expect of a 4 star hotel. Our experience of the service was personal & incredibly thoughtful. When asked how we were, we mentioned that it was my partner's birthday. When we checked in formally later that day we found a birthday card in our room from the reception team inviting us for a drink at the bar. All the staff were always cheerful & helpful. The rooms were very tidy (we had a deluxe) & the facilites were very clean. We were on the 12th floor and it was very quiet - No street noise to speak of. The location is handy with lots of fashion & food shopping nearby & only moderate walk (or short bus trip if you prefer) to the waterfront attractions. There was a useful bus route only a minutes walk away. It's only a 10 minute to the nearest train station which is goes direct to the airports (domestic & international) - Very handy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Oxford Street”
Reviews.Author: Brass612
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for a place to stay closer to Oxford Street. Stayed here over Mardi Gras 2011 and it was super convenient to the restaurants, shops and bars along Oxford Street, which is just a block away. Getting to the CityRail wasn't too bad, but requires a 10 min walk to the Museum Station. The rooms were fine, the bed was comfortable, and overall everything was clean and relatively new. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The only minor fault would be the lack of affordable wi-fi. It's available but expensive. The staff will direct you to some nearby coffee shops that have it for far cheaper. Overall I would recommend the Quality Hotel Cambridge if you are looking for a place in this part of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a thorough update”
Reviews.Author: twistopher
Reviews.Content: Bathroom floor dirty, god knows what was on the wall, but it wasn't mine. Entire bathroom had been painted - tiles, bath tub, you name it. Breakfast was awful for $15 - not sure where the sausages came from, but it wasn't an animal that i know of - try the street parallel and directly behind the hotel, thats what a breakfast should be for the same $15. Good pub across the road for dinner and a few pints (if a little cold - the people). Wouldn't stay there again - unless its been renovated. And wi-fi was extortionate - don't bother. 2 plastic seats and a glass table don't cut it for working from

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk”
Reviews.Author: nycmia
Reviews.Content: The front desk is excellent. They allowed me to check in early and gave me a better room since others were not yet available. I needed to use their Internet terminals for about 15 minutes to check a few things and pay a bill and they gave me complimentary access. Finally when I was out shopping I decided against buying some electronic equipment that had an improper price tag. The store clerk canceled the transaction as a suspicious activity which then American Express restricted my card (did not find out about it until I tried using it again.) The front desk helped me to get through to American Express to correct the problem. Rooms are very clean although nothing fancy. The hotels is located closed to the Museum train stop, buses to Bondi, downtown, and a grocery store. The price was very reasonable. I will be staying here on a my yearly trip to Sydney for now on.

Reviews.Title: “Good for stopover”
Reviews.Author: millport-1
Reviews.Content: reception staff excellent, room very spacious except no drawer space. Hotel was spotless as was the room. Not much choice on evening menu, so ate out. Hotel situated a bit out of town but you could still walk to Darling Harbour and Opera House etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our 6 night stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: DarthPaulo
Reviews.Content: We wanted an inexpensive no frills hotel for our stay and were very happy here. We arrived early for check in and were allowed to leave our cases in storage and use complimentary showers after our flight. Staff were nice and really helpful. Map provided along with some directions. Our room was a deluxe one on a high floor with a balcony. Very spacious, good shower. There were no drawers to store clothes though which was suprising given the size of the room. The Wifi was terrible and expensive. Location wise easy walk to Surrey Hills where there is an abundance of lovely restaurants that you wouldn't neccessarily go to if you were staying in the centre of town or Darling Harbour etc. We found some gems and were therefore delighted with the location. You can walk to Hyde Park and Darling Harbour fairly easily - about 10 and 20 mins respectively. Opera House too far in the heat. There are bus stops nearby and liquor stores, Internet cafe and supermarket all on the doorstep. Breakfast here was not great so do not recommend you get it included and instead venture to Bills a few blocks away for the best brekkies ever! Overall though this hotel was spot on and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let the Neighbourhood Worry You”
Reviews.Author: 74gremlin
Reviews.Content: The neighbourhood doesn't look the best, but the hotel was great. The lobby and our room were clean. The room had a bedroom as well as a sitting room with a couch, table and chairs. A grocery store is right across the road, so we picked up food and self-catered for many of our meals. It's a nice walk to Sydney Harbour that probably took about a half an hour. And the price was pretty good for a Sydney hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, decent area”
Reviews.Author: spdrcr_09
Reviews.Content: I struggled to find a hotel in Sydney with the prime location and decent price. This was as close as I could find. Rooms are clean and cozy; staff is very friendly and helpful, but the location.....well it's close to the center, but a little too close to the "other side" of town. It's real close to the gay area of town; normally wouldn't bother me, but these people a very flamboyant. I had no issues or problems, just for some reason felt a little uncomftorable being that close to clubs/bars that welcomed that lifestyle. Not that there is anything wrong with that, I just felt I had to go a little further out to find bars/clubs that suited my comfort zone,

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Evelyn and Tim on reception who were very friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: SteveDonUK
Reviews.Content: Although it's a little walk to all the sights, the hotel is clean enough and rooms are a good size all at a reasonable price! The best thing about the place though was the friendly and helpful reception staff. In particular Evelyn (hope I spelt her name correctly) who gave us a very welcoming greeting when we were checking in and was very helpful despite us being a few hours early. Tim was also very helpful and assisted us with a few enquiries we had about getting round the city. Thanks to you both for making our stay that bit more enjoyable. Steve & Amy from the UK

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: Johnawc1981
Reviews.Content: Located in a seedy part of town, the rooms are marginal. The bright spot is the staff who are doing the best that they can given what they have to work with. Our room appeared to be an add on adjacent to an in door pool. The humidity, noise and condition of the room made us glad that this was a one day stop. There are many better choices in Sydney. Parking was available, but it was expensive and difficult to get in and out of.

Reviews.Title: “OK at the right price”
Reviews.Author: AusTripPlanner
Reviews.Content: There was nothing terrible about this place but nothing great either. I would say if you can get it cheap it's worth it but at the price I paid I expected more. The room had been refurbished but was already looking dated. It was large and had a small balcony with no chairs. Staff were friendly but as has been mentioned didn't assist with calling cabs and you generally had to walk to Oxford street. I liked the location as it was an easy walk to pubs/cafes in Surry Hills but the again I wasn't sightseeing. Would I stay again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Carl_Pressman
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, Very Friendly Staff that really try to make you feel comfortable, the rooms are clean and it was quite. Only slight drawback is Hotelâ€™s location; although Surry Hills is a nice inner-city â€�hipâ€� location it is a bit far from most major Sydney Attractions like the Darling Harbor, Chinatown, Skytower , Opera House and Circle Quay Ferry Terminal. All these Attractions are walking distance. We walked at all times of the day and night and it felt quite safe as with no issues. Police station is across the street. Overall we are pleased with our stay and in my opinion this is a very good hotel choice at the $150.00 per night level.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT LOCATION IN THE HEART OF SYDNEY!!”
Reviews.Author: LYNMCGLYNN
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 days 27th/29th december 2010. lovely room, brill location next to sky tower!! went to manley. saw opera house n bridge. hotel staff brill n knew abt area. laundry v good.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently welcoming and helpful, comfortable rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jac009
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit for me, first time with my family and our experience at Cambridge Hotel did not disappoint. We had an excellent room with balcony and city views and enough space for us all to relax. Staff without exception were friendly and efficient. Information and advice about attractions, local transport options etc is freely available without any pressure to book via hotel. We did not eat at the restaurant - one of the great things about this hotel is its proximity to a wide variety of restaurants and cheap eats all within easy walking distance and all we tried welcomed children. Also handy for families is supermarket open until midnight and virtually opposite the Hotel. Train and monorail stations also within walking distance but I would recommend a stroller for young children. Perhaps only area for improvement would be to provide seating around indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “For a mid market hotel, if the price is right you wont be upset staying here”
Reviews.Author: jetskijames
Reviews.Content: Great staff, very large room,amazing shower pressure , small pool but access on request to a good gym down the road. This hotel is quite a good base in a central, but non harbour location. the rooms are clean,with good cotton sheets. Although well maintained there is a feeling that more detail and finishing touches are required.something just doesnt feel welcoming about the room but I dont dislike it. overall a good hotel if you want to be in darlinghurst area. I would recomend this hotel if you are happy with the price represents a mid market, not luxury hotel

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, extremely good value”
Reviews.Author: Krishky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the middle of November when my parents came to visit. Everything from check-in to check-out was friendly and done with a smile. Nothing was too much hassle for any staff member we dealt. Adam and Steven were amazingly helpful organising my birthday dinner which was held in the Penthouse- some of the most amazing views are to be had from the balconies up there. I had the best 30th birthday thanks to all the staff at the hotel. We managed to book 3 day trips with the hotel- all of which were good. Pick ups from the hotel were prompt and the driver/tour guides were friendly. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone I know,friends and family alike to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service but most of all friendly staff.Front desk great.”
Reviews.Author: TITCH069
Reviews.Content: I would like to extend my thanks to the front desk for all their help especially as I was travelling on my own.I had no fault to find with the staff and my room was always good to come home to after the CRICKET. Australian,s must learn that some one has to LOOSE Many thanks KEN

Reviews.Title: “Beware the windowless rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Chestyblonde
Reviews.Content: Beware the rooms at the rear of this hotel which only have windows facing inwards, they are dark, noisy and hot from their close proximity to the swimming pool. We were told that these were the 'reserve rooms', in other words you haven't paid much so what did you expect? In all fairness we were relocated at our request, however had the hotel been busier we would have been stuck with a room we didn't want to spend any time in.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean hotel, friendly staff and well located.”
Reviews.Author: SYDNEYMELBOURNE
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable stay. Well located and within walking distance of city centre / harbour attractions. Hotel was comfortable and clean and staff provided a first class and friendly service. Evening meals provided represented good value. Would use again and recommend with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “All that we needed”
Reviews.Author: MacMaree
Reviews.Content: If your looking for luxury then this is maybe not the hotel for you. We were in Sydney for 5 days and needed somewhere central and clean that wasn't too budget. The Cambridge is a 5 min walk to Surrey Hills, which was an awesome place to shop and eat. It was a 15-20 min leisurely through Hyde Park to the Pitt Street Malls and 30min walk to the Oprah House. We didn't need to use public transport as it was so handy to everything we needed. The hotel itself was clean and the room was contemporary in it's fittings. The bed was comfy and being on the 10th floor we had a nice view of the surrounding area. The staff were professional and nice enough. The only complaint/issue is the luggage storage area. You are just given a key and then you drop it off yourself to the room, which is fine for honest folk, but could almost have been a cheap Christmas shopping experience for the less honest people of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel stones throw to all the action”
Reviews.Author: Rodney2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel situated in a great location, donâ€™t be put off by the police station across the road as we never heard the sirens from there. If you do not mind a nice stroll through busy Sydney, all of the popular tourist sites are all within a 3km walk. If walking is not your style bus & train stations are relatively close by. The staff was very chipper & helpful even the room attendants always greeted us with an â€œGood morningâ€� & a smile. My only gripe is, not sure if it was just the room we stayed in but PLEASE, PLEASE change the size of the fridge, itâ€™s not like there is no room for a bigger one, just move the ironing board! As we stayed for 5 nights, I donâ€™t know call me a tight a%*e but sorry I think that all of the food outlets in & around the tourist spots are way over priced for the quality & quantity of food you get. I would not like to be travelling for a week or more watching the pennies & with growing kids that need feeding. So my preference would be a bigger fridge, so that we could have purchased items from supermarkets for breakfast & lunch, not so much diner as there are plenty of great places to choose from including 212, the little pub on the corner & then of course Oxford & Crown Streets. I can hear all of you saying now â€œif you want a bigger fridge why didnâ€™t you book an apartmentâ€�, please refer back to â€œbeing a tight a%*eâ€� & â€œwatching the pennies!â€� Overall fantastic place to stay & would stay there again & would also recommend to friends, family & anyone that would listen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jags52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cambridge for two weeks and was really delighted with the room we were given The room had a balcony with a view of the city and the Opera House, a small kitchenette with a microwave and fridge, television and a/c. The room was clean and tidy with sheets and towels changed daily. The reception staff were really friendly and always asked if everything was ok. They also made bookings for excursions, taxis and airport transfers for us. The front desk manager, Adam and general manager Steven made us feel really welcome and were always there when we needed them. The hotel also has a swimming pool, restaurant and bar. Oxford Street, a three minute walk from the hotels has a number of restaurants, bars, clubs, supermarkets, banks, ATM's other shops. The city centre, China Town and Paddy's Market is only a 20-30 minute stroll from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to couples and families and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great attitude amongst the staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LaRosa_NZ
Reviews.Content: I just came across a note I took with the names of people who made our stay enjoyable, so even though it was Aug 2010 when we holidayed in Sydney, I want to add our praise. We originially booked to stay only 3 nights, thinking we'd pick somewhere else for our last night once we'd worked out where everything was. But the staff and location were unbeatable! Our thanks to Daniella, Natalie Lereau - and especially to Bruno Dinis who moved things around a little so we could stay the extra night. Nothing was too much bother. And each morning the friendly staff on the front desk showed interest in our plans for the day - and gave us tips to gets us where we wanted to go. A grocery store, pharmacist and bottle store were all in easy walking distance. As were the buses and trains. Having never been to Sydney before, I couldn't believe how perfectly we'd fluked such a great place to stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “'Wonderful'”
Reviews.Author: Lucca888
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cambridge for 2 nights and We are so pleased that we wanted to let everyone know about this hotel The Cambridge is just around the corner from The Winery, Crown Street and Hyde Park. There are heaps of fashionale boutiques, trendy cafes, wine bars and restaurants. It's situated in the best part of Surry Hills Surry Hills is fast becoming the SoHo of Sydney. The hotel is also an easy 10 minutes walk to the new Westfield in the city. It's a wonderful place to stay if you are looking for value and something different and trendy The young staff were very friendly; the room was large and very clean ; most of all the bed was heaven Overall we loved the hotel - we prefer to stay here than the city as we were experiencing the real Sydney life style and lived amongst the locals

Reviews.Title: “A great experience - so close to everything Sydney can Share”
Reviews.Author: wpiper
Reviews.Content: The Quality Hotel Cambridge is a great place to launch your stay in Sydney - We walked to most places in thecity and enjoyed the experience greatly - A great place - clean and so easy ..

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful young staff”
Reviews.Author: Bluey99
Reviews.Content: The Cambridge is a spotlessly-renovated property, and its location in Surrey Hills is very convenient for walking around Sydney. It looks like a 1960's tower - about 14 stories. It's a longish (but pleasant) walk to Circular Quay or The Rocks, but not so far to Hyde Park. There are lots of good restaurants in the surrounding areas of Darlinghurst and Surrey Hills. We stayed three nights - the first in a very small but adequate room. We were then moved into a balcony room which was really quite spacious and much better. It's $20 for 24 hours of internet connection, which is an irritation, but still quite a fast and efficient service. Hotel staff seemed to be mainly young and international. It's not all perfect - There is a slightly cramped feel to the lobby, the corridors and the lifts - all pretty small and tight, and can get crowded. Still, at a very reasonable price, in an excellent location, and with friendly and efficient staff - a good deal overall.

Reviews.Title: “Utilitarian but convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: sevenseat
Reviews.Content: I had been in the Australia on business for several days and my wife flew in on Friday morning for a long weekend. I had been staying in a hotel in the suburbs, but we wanted a more central hotel for the weekend. I had read many of the reviews on this site and found myself wondering if I was staying in the same hotel once I arrived. Location: This hotel is in the southern end of the city. I would forget about walking to the main attractions around Circular Quay or Darling Harbour, as it will take you at least 30 minutes. You will find yourself wanting to take a bus or CityRail, but more on that later. Oxford Street is right around the corner and has numerous clubs, pubs, coffee shops and reasonably priced restaurants (Sitar is fantastic). There is a supermarket in Oxford Square on the corner of Oxford and Riley Streets. Be aware that even though Hyde Park is right around the corner, I donâ€™t see how any of the rooms in the hotel can have a view with all of the buildings in the way. The proximity to Oxford Street does come with some noise, but our location on the 12th floor helped muffle the sound. Transportation: CityRail is very convenient, but is not as close to the hotel as you might think. Itâ€™s about a ten minute walk, entirely up hill, from Museum Station to the hotel. Be aware that there is no lift in Museum Station, so if you are hauling bags from the airport to the hotel, you will have to carry them up several flights of stairs. Trains to and from the airports stop at Museum, just check the monitors for a little airplane symbol. There is an additional gate charge at the airport stations that amounts to $10 one way, or $18 for a 7 day return ticket. It seems like a money grab that people just put up with because itâ€™s still cheaper than taxis. The CityRail MyMulti ticket is a good deal if you are staying for a couple of days, as the hotelâ€™s location will have you riding busses or trains to get to most of the sights. The MyMulti ticket allows you to ride all of the trains, busses and ferries for one price. Just check the zones and make sure you get the correct ticket for where you want to travel, you donâ€™t want to pay for trains to zones 2 and 3 if you wonâ€™t be going that far. The busses are also very convenient, and sometimes easier than the trains. There are bus stops on Oxford Street and you can catch a bus in to Circular Quay and out to Bondai Beach from Oxford Street. The train to Bondai actually goes as far as Bondai Junction and then you will have to get on the same bus that goes right up Oxford Street, so just use the bus to begin with. Rooms: We were given an upgrade from the â€œPremiumâ€� room that I had booked to a â€œDeluxeâ€� room with a balcony. I have no idea what room they took the pictures of for the web site, but it was far from â€œDeluxeâ€�. It had an uncomfortably firm queen bed with institutional grade bedding. The remainder of the furnishings were below college dormitory grade. The love seat and chair shown in the picture were nowhere to be found. The carpet was a depressing industrial grey. The bathroom was nice but tiny, with a shower and not the tub that is shown on the web site. The balcony was utilitarian, with a view of an alley and the neighboring building, and there was no screen on the large sliding glass door to keep out bugs. The â€œlarge flat screen LCD televisionâ€� was awkwardly mounted low in the corner, and had a very limited channel lineup, that included what seemed to be the all soccer channel and the all cricket channel. With only ten rooms to a floor, it is hard to get a room that is not close to the elevator, and therefore subject to noise from drunk guests waiting for the elevator late at night. Public Areas: We didnâ€™t use the hotel restaurant. There is a Gloria Jeanâ€™s Coffee on Oxford Street where you can get breakfast for two for less than one can eat in the hotel. The lobby is clean and functional. When we arrived, our room wasnâ€™t ready and my wife wanted to shower off 27 hours of travel. They gave us soap, shampoo, a towel and a key to the pool. The shower room by the pool did not have a lock on the door, and there is no mirror for hair, makeup, shaving, etc. The pool is tiny and the area around the pool had all the charm of a prison cell block. Internet Access: The WiFi signal was strong on the 12th floor and it seemed that they had the hotel well covered, but $20 a day seemed excessive. Similar grade hotels in the States and Europe include it for free. In summary, if you go in to this hotel with the right expectations, it will serve its purposes, and it is priced accordingly considering the cost of other hotels in Sydney. I would not go out of my way to stay here, but would consider it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality”
Reviews.Author: adventurers_9
Reviews.Content: This was just such a great & friendly hotel! The staff there knew everything about all the places we wanted to visit in Sydney while I stayed there and they gave great recommendations on places to eat and tours to do. It has a really cool vibe when you walk in and even has a bright yellow scooter in the foyer. We stayed in the deluxe spa suite which was well worth what we paid. One of the best places I've stayed in Sydney - highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic management response to problem”
Reviews.Author: Steeplerock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our way to a wedding in the Hunter Valley and had a few problems with the booking, which was a last minute deal through Expedia. The room we were offered was not of a type or standard we were expecting based on our booking confirmation. However I can only applaud the way the hotel management have dealt with this issue and resolved it for us in a totally professional and very courteous way. Our poor opinion has been wiped away. This hotel is in a great location - just be very clear that you know what you are getting in terms of a room when you book. My congratulations to the hotel team - you know your stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Amandiene31
Reviews.Content: We booked a premier room and paid on average 165 AUD per night. The room was spacious and clean. Staff friendly and helpful. Great Location - lots of nice little bars and restaurants within walking distance. The car park is dark and narrow and for 25 AUD (20 on the weekend) not cheap. Overall good value for money and I can recommend this hotel! Comment to the management for improvement: we looked at the guest laundry room and decided not to wash our clothes there. It could use a good cleaning! A soap dish in the bathroom would be a helpful accessories as we were trying to keep the soap from sliding into the sink all the time with whatever we could find.

Reviews.Title: “Great value within easy walking distance of restaurants and public transportation”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Go44
Reviews.Content: The Quality Hotel Cambridge is a great value, and suited our needs perfectly. We were looking for a clean and comfortable hotel in a safe location within easy reach of public transportation, and the Quality Hotel didn't disappoint. The Museum stop on the City Rail is just a ten minute walk down Oxford Street. There is also a grocery store and liquor store just two blocks up the street, as well as numerous restaurants within an easy walk of the hotel. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful every step of the way. We stayed in two different rooms (left Sydney to travel to Cairns, then returned for another night's stay), and both were spacious and clean. We'd definitely recommend the Quality Hotel to anyone looking for a good mid-range hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Never_om
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the internet and when we arrived we were allocated a room in the pool block. We immediately asked to be moved as this was very noisy, basic and dark. We could not get a change as the hotel was full and was asked to return the next morning. Fortunately we found the staff and especially Raphel ? was very helpful and when we returned the same day we had been allocated a room on the 5th floor which was a 100% improvement on the first one. We were informed that the block that we had initially had stayed in, was due for demolish, it needs to be! However the new room was clean and had a small kitchen facilities, sitting area and seperate bedroom. The hotel is well located for the centre, and Darling harbour although is a walk to circular quay, you can buy the mymulti pass and get buses around the city, including the quay, Bondi, and ferries to Manly etc. Next to the hotel there is Crown street with some really good restaurants and take outs. The hotel is comfortable and clean, and we would recommend it, as its great value for money, as long as your not in the pool block!

Reviews.Title: “One of the happiest times of my life”
Reviews.Author: Tweedy888
Reviews.Content: Quality Hotel Cambridge is a very trendy boutique style hotel. The rooms are good sizes with a very relaxing and trendy ambience. Having breakfast in the hotel restaruant was yumbo. I would eat there every day of the week if I could. Location was excellent close to near by sporting stadiums, restaurants and bus trip or even walk to the city. The staff were reall upbeat, friendly and on the ball. After a good night out on the town we had the best sleeps in the comfy beds and to my amazment, there was little if any noise. Definatlety going to go back there. Hopefully soon

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley fabulous - attention to detail excellent”
Reviews.Author: fun070952
Reviews.Content: Arrival and check-in - staff were very attentive and we were looked after with excellent efficiency. Our room was immaculately clean and the presentation was exceptional. We were able to travel to our destination in Sydney city within 5 minutes. We had a very restful night's sleep after a long day and evening. Check-out was fast and easy. All staff should be congratulated on their friendly and attentive service. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Exceptional friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jilliby09
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Cambridge before, and once again it didn't dissapoint on my most recent visit. The hotel has a funky, fresh feeling, with lovely large rooms, and is excellent value for money. For me though, the staff are what makes the difference and really has me returning. From the moment you walk in the front doors, the front desk staff are always friendly, smiling, professional and can't do enough to help. Check-in is fast and efficient, and it makes you feel so welcome that the staff take the time to ask about your day. I must make mention of Adam on the front desk - on my recent trip he was such a great help. He provided recommendations for places to eat, as well as directions to local shops and a couple of places in Sydney that we wanted to visit. He has a great knowledge of the area, took the time to really understand what we were looking for, and even went so far as to help us make a booking. We were so impressed that he provided us with such an exceptional level of service. Thanks to all at the Cambridge for yet another great stay. I'll be returning again, and would happily recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay in Sydney - whether its for work or a holiday, you won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 88Londoner
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on a web site prior to my trip to Sydney and was extremely satisfied with the hotel. I chose the hotel because the hotel won ample services awards, I stayed in the Cambridge for 7 days for business and a bit of leisure and the best thing about the hotel was the friendly services from all the staff, especially the well presented ladies on the front desk. The room was extremely spacious with great city skyline views and a balcony that I could open the door. The room was very clean and in addition the bed was fantastic. The hotel was within walking distance to my meetings in the CBD, and was surrounded by great restaurants, bars and boutiques. Its in a very trendy area of Sydney. Thank you Cambridge, i had a fantastic stay and will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but noise issues”
Reviews.Author: reefdive
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed three nights in Sydney, two nights (Saturday and Sunday) at the Cambridge and another night (Monday) at the Radisson Hotel on Liverpool. The two nights at the Cambridge were kind of at the last minute because of a change in our plans. I have written a review of the Radisson as well. We stayed at the Cambridge mainly we were on a budget and were out and about during our stay in Sydney. The front desk staff was very helpful and professional. The Premium Queen room with a balcony was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is about a 20 - 30 minute walk to Darling Harbor. The reasons we gave the hotel a 3 star rating was because of the noise and bathroom. Our hotel room faced Riley Street, from which we could hear music. I don't know if there was a club or bar nearby, but the music was noticeably loud. Also, our room was near the elevator, so we could hear the other guests, 20-year-olds, coming in late from a night on the town and leaving the next morning. We could even hear room service knocking on the door late at night and the guests speaking with him. We slept better the next night since it was basically my wife and I staying on the floor. However, the next morning around 7am, we were woken by construction noise. It seems that work begins around 7am in Australia. Some reviewers have commented on not experiencing noise problems; others have. I guess it depends on the location of the room, the type of guests on your floor, and which nights you stay. The other issue is the bathroom and shower were small. The shower door is on a track and sometimes it was dragging when trying to close it. Overall, it was a good value, but I would highly recommend that if staying at the Cambridge to ask for a room not facing Riley Street, especially on a Friday or Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, the location isn't that good...”
Reviews.Author: guthi
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, the location isn't that good. But you get a lovely walk to the center of Sydney through Hyde Park.

Reviews.Title: “a good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: charltonfc
Reviews.Content: Had a really good stay here,the kids loved it and all the staff were excellent.(especially the room service team who done a brilliant job!).The hotel is situated near oxford street and was ok for getting to the touristy areas(my 8 year olds had no problems walking downt to the harbourside and back!) We had a meal at the hotel and was a little expensive(everything in sydney is!)but the best food we had all holiday.We hired a car and there was ample parking at the hotel but a little tight in areas! thankyou all for a really nice stay and a good start to our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff in a convenient spot”
Reviews.Author: sleepyhead_10
Reviews.Content: We needed somewhere to stay for a couple of days in Sydney before and after a cruise ship voyage.The Cambridge was a convenient spot to take in the city sights which were well within walking distance.Staff were professional, well groomed and accommodating to our every needs.From holding our luggage in a secure location before check in time to sorting out a squabble between taxi drivers, we were impressed with the customer service throughout our stay.Our room was well appointed, the restaurant served up a good feed.Should you wish to dine elsewhere, there is no shortage of places nearby.Our only gripe was that the lift foyers and room corridors were a bit pokey to transport our baggage around, but then again we were lugging a fair bit.We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Views”
Reviews.Author: MountainmanDromore
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what the official star rating is for this hotel but it probably falls into the 2/3 star category in relation to decor. I was attracted to this hotel by the price, the proximity to the centre of Sydney and the Central railway station and also the views from the rooms on the higher floors. The actual visit met my expectations on these issues. However this is really a basic hotel with a small plain lobby. The corridor outside the rooms is like something from a low budget motel. Again the room was large, but poorly decorated although clean and I enjoyed a comfortable nights sleep. I would return to this hotel again but the reality is it is just a room to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “What areat hotel”
Reviews.Author: NambuccaHeadsNorma
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cambridge as it was close to the Belvoir Theatre. Glad we did, we have found a top spot. Great staff, competent, efficient and thoughtful. Enjoyed a meal in the restaurant after a matinee show, the waiter was friendly and made the evening a pleasure due to his We would both stay there again and have recommended the hotel to family and friends. Keep up the good work Cambridge. We had time to spare before an afternoon flight so spent time walking around looking at the old terrace houses, then up to the Sydney CBD to shop. A bit of a walk by the time we got back but enjoyable just the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location!”
Reviews.Author: WayneBennett
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week to visit Sydney. Excellent: - Room and furnishings were very nice - Hotel was well kept up and looked like it had been recently remodeled into a "modern" theme - Restaurant was tasty - and convenient, both for breakfast and other meals - Breakfast buffet at $14.95 (AUD) was an excellent value - hot and cold foods every morning - Location next to Oxford St night life was great - Walking distance to Capitol Theater and china town and Starbucks (half a mile) (but Gloria Jean's was closer - two blocks) - Let me keep my rented bicycle in my room - Nice views of the town (on my 9th floor room) - Excellent house keeping - very prompt every day - Across the street from the Surrey Hills Police Department (e.g. good safety, but no sirens in middle of night!) Not so great: - Shower hot water not consistently hot (it went back and forth between luke warm and scalding) - Shower doors fell off track every time I opened or closed them - No "hot" tub - "spa" was heated to same temp as the rest of the pool; too cool to sit in comfortably. But "bubbles" worked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teithiwr-y-byd
Reviews.Content: Great value place in a great location just off Oxford street. Stayed here for a number of nights in September 2010. The room was large with a comfortable bed and I had no noise problems as I was on one the upper floors. The room had a balcony and great city views. Staff were professional and courteous and I had no problems checking in or out. Would have received a 5 star rating if the wifi internet costs were not so ridiculously priced at $20 per day for wifi access.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a bit of a hike from harbor area”
Reviews.Author: Mandy_in_Japan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, comfortable and with rather large rooms. Breakfast buffet had a good selection every morning.
