However, the place was popular with large student tour groups so the lobby was often crowded with kids hanging out or waiting to check in/leave on a tour/etc. It was a bit of a hike from here to the Rocks/Circular Quay area, about 15-20 minutes, which wasn't terrible but with Sydney in a cold snap it made for a long, chilly hike!

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming, spacious, comfortable, good value stay in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: garym000
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming, staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms had everything you need. Lots of space, we travelled with a toddler. Beds were comfortable, bathrooms clean and room service very prompt. Had a good resturant and bar . Location walking distance to everything as public trasport. Great stay will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good sized rooms, pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: murphy_sa
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotels based on other reviews and was not disappointed. We got a corner room on the 11th floor and were pleasantly surprised with the standard. Large living area with couch, wall-mounted tv and a desk for your laptop etc. No microwave but fridge, safe, tea and coffee facilities, ironing board etc. Comfortable bedding and large, well equipped bathroom. Nice pool and spa area on Level 2 also. Staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Location is also great - right around the corner from Oxford Street with plenty of bars and restaurants. Internet in the rooms is decent value - $20 for 24 hours. Would definitely stay here on my next trip to Sydney and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Most welcome stay in sydney in many years”
Reviews.Author: NswOldie
Reviews.Content: The service was wonderful from all members of staff & the room was exellent and very clean which included a balcony The food in the resteraunt was very good and at the right price The trip to Sydney was for the first week of radiotherapy cancer treatment and the stay was that pleasant we are returning to the Cambridge next week for 5 more weeks Well done team! & thank you Adam

Reviews.Title: “Coolest + Best”
Reviews.Author: bettyboo97
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cambridge Hotel last Thursday and Friday night for the first time. I booked the rooms on the internet as it was very easy to navigate. My flight was late and I checked in fairly late but the hotel receptionist was really welcoming and I was upgraded to a large deluxe room. She was one of the best receptionist i had encountered, very kind, helpful and accommodating. The room was HUGE and I even had a large balcony with city skyline view. the bed was really comfotable I had the best night sleep ever. The hotel is walking distance to heaps of fashionable and hip shops, its 10 minutes walk to Paddington Oxford Street. The hotel is fantastic and I am looking forward to be back soon for my next shopping trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in prfect locations”
Reviews.Author: Cambridge2010
Reviews.Content: I have just recently stayed two nights in this hotel. Lifts, room and corridors were clean and nicely appointed. Personnel were very friendly and always helpful, Lee in particular. I can easily recommend this place to anyone who wants to spend few days in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Doris86
Reviews.Content: I'm a local pub owner who is staying at the hotel while my place is being renovated, and this hotel is amazing, such a lovely experience, I'd love to stay longer. The rooms were lovely and clean, the breakfast was exceptional especially the service I received, so very friendly. I ask the young lady for a recommendation and it was an appertising meal. I can't remember her name, but a Big thank you to her for making it special. It goes to show that a little attention to detail makes a huge impression. She is an asset to anyone in this industry. I was so pleased with the overall stay, I will definately let anyone who visits my pub know of the hotel. A job well done Quality Cambridge Hotel A+.

Reviews.Title: “Quality & Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: kristyleemann
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a prime position for a short walk to the hub of Oxford St as well as several train stations, and the CBD. The staff are extremly friendly and went above and beyond to ensure our stay was enjoyable and stressfree as possible for my whole party (myself, sister, niece and nephew). The room was bright, very clean and spacious with enough room for the kids to play around! The hotels resteraunt was also another fantastic feature with a great varied menu that caters for all tastes. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone from couples to families!

Reviews.Title: “Looking for the perfect place to stay in Sydney? Do yourself a favour and choose the Quality Hotel Cambridge.”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneTruci
Reviews.Content: Situated in exciting Surry Hills, it is in an ideal location, within walking distance to many of the famous attractions Sydney has to offer. On arrival, we were welcomed by very friendly and professional staff who looked after us happily and attentively during our whole stay. Our room was bright, clean and inviting and we were impressed with the tasty food offered in the Hotel's restaurant. I would not hesitate in recommending this 'gem' and look forward to staying there again many more times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service with a Smile!!”
Reviews.Author: suzieth
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing! Stayed in a Deluxe Room - The room was clean, modern, quiet, comfortable, spacious and very convenient. From start to finish, the hotel staff were very helpful, friendly and effiecient. Location is just around corner from Oxford Street where you are never stuck for a great meal and a social atmosphere, and within minutes from everywhere else. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4* hotel (up to 100 AUD)on the City of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: wirpool
Reviews.Content: I used to stay two times (in July 2009 and last time in April 2010). I like it very much because of itsvery nice, cosy and clean room. It is one of the best priced hotels in the City of Sydney. Just 3 min away from park and just next door to night life. I would recommend it as for business people as well as for traveles. 2007 - 2010 it has been nominated for City of Sydney Business Awards under Best Mid range accommodation. I used to buy breakfast for 15 AUD, but I do not like it. It is better to go out the hotel. Threre are a lot of nece eating places around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Ally056
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location....walking distance to major tourist attractions of Sydney - Sydney Tower, Sydney Aqurium, Darling Harbour etc etc Staff very helpful, friendly and accomodating -Not through fault of Hotel, but on arrival our room was not that suitable for myself, Husband and two young children. When telling staff, every attempt was made to change us to a room more suitable to our needs which was done on the same day. This room was perfect and at no extra cost. Children friendly Hotel ++++. The Restaurant and Bar exceeded our expectations and are above average quality. Would definately choose this Hotel on our next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay just as good as first”
Reviews.Author: adampfb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year with friends. Came back this year for a hoilday and was as good as last year. Great service and food. Staff can not do enough to help. Rooms clean and good price. Its near everything I need on hoilday. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Venue for Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: MackayLyn
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this Hotel for a Family Reunion. This was a big event with family members from all over Australia, yet the service was wonderful, right from book-in to booking out. The staff were exceedingly helpful and polite and the rooms were spacious , clean and comfortable. The food was of a high standard. The location is close enough to the city to eat at numerous other venues very close to the hotel. I will definitely choose this venue for other functions and stop-overs.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Very Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CaseyAuckland
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel end of june, early July. We had an overall very good experience. We were able to get a special for drive, stay and eat which worked out very affordable for the three of us. The full buffet breakfasts each morning were fantastic. Great selection of both hot and cold food - kept us going for hours!! The rooms were very clean and suitable for the three of us. Beds were very comfy! Rooms were on the smaller side however we were there to sightsee and not spend all the time in the room, so this didn't bother us! Staff were very friendly and were more than happy to help! This hotel is not in the real CENTRE of Sydney - around a 10min walk to George St, however we did know this prior to booking and as we expected, it didn't bother us at all! Probably a good thing as there is less traffic noise than most city centre hotels! Museum station is only a 5min walk from hotel so really not an issue being a little outer city centre. Would definitely recommend/stay at this hotel again. Thanks Quality Hotel Cambridge for a great stay! We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: biggaplanet
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend staying here- difficult experience all round

Reviews.Title: “bugs!”
Reviews.Author: VagabondCND
Reviews.Content: Yes, bugs. Those little tiny creatures that usually accompany a lack of cleanliness. Leftover food particles are often the culprit. They could be spoted in the bathroom and on the desk. Otherwise, this was a nice enough hotel (in case you are still considering it). The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The hotel appears to have been redone in the not-too-distant past, so decor is relatively current. The room is not set out very well, though. Its walls are completely bare, the desk and one (not very comfortable) chair are not within view of the television. The bed is quite comfortable, as are the pillows. The location is quite good: a grocery store is one block away, and both Oxford and Crown streets are 2-3 blocks away (good shopping - independent design district). You can walk to Central Station (although the walk from it to the hotel is a bit cumbersome with bags - all uphill). The Museum Station (city rail) is about a 5 minute walk, as is the central city (several shopping arcades/malls, as well as city sights). If they solve the bug problem, this would be a good enough hotel. I would still not pay full price, though - check for last minute deals.

Reviews.Title: “Hoping for more from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeneTamworth
Reviews.Content: We wanted somewhere interesting, out of the CBD and as far as location goes it was ok albeit the "wrong" end of Crown Street, still felt safe and it was a comfortable walk to Crown Street restaurants as well as the CBD. The staff were ok, no one and nothing stood out one way or the other. The restaurant food however stood out for being very unappetising. BLT was dried out and inedible, French Onion soup like dish water with cold dried out cheese on toast. Twice housekeeping staff walked into the room after a very short knock, it could have been embarrassing but luckily it wasn't. When I rang the day after check out realising i'd left a special pillow behind, I was told that housekeeping didn't have it.I know I left it on the bed, very disappointed. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there many times for the convenient location”
Reviews.Author: shezz84
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Cambridge Hotel on many occasions, mainly due to the convenient location, right next to Oxford St and a 15min walk into town. The rooms are bit hit and miss in terms of quality and size, but generally clean. Not all rooms are necessarily the quietest for sleeping. It's good for business travellers if you don't have such high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “location and quality”
Reviews.Author: taniaac8
Reviews.Content: Friends recommended this hotel on the edge of the city centre. Such a good handy location - sort of boutique style hotel but with all comforts. Rooms have been renovated and the staff are so helpful. Good meals in the resaurant . A must to recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a wander around Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights, had not stayed here previously but familiar with the vicinity. From start to finish, service super friendly and helpful, room inexpensive but great. Location is just around corner from Oxford Street where you are never stuck for a great meal and a social atmosphere, and within minutes from everywhere else. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel that we would recommend to anybody.”
Reviews.Author: Defaoite01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on very convenient bus route to Circular Quay which is an essential requirement for any tourist. The Hotel staff were very helpful and pleasant and the rooms left nothing to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: adrianwc18
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of most attractions. (Good Point) Breakfast expensive $6.50 for a cereal if taken in the rooms. (Expensive) Booked 2 rooms one the size of the SCG the other the centre square of the SCG. (Disappointed 2nd Room) Both very noisey facing Riley Street. No sound proofing to windows. (Worst Point) $112 to park car under hotel, should be free for guests. (Greedy) No Sauna or Gym found as advertised on web pages? If you want a good nights sleep I do not recommend this hotel, unless you can get a room not facing the main street.

Reviews.Title: “five out of five....had a fantastic time durin my stay.would certainly come back over n over again.”
Reviews.Author: babaaal
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at the hotel during my visit with my family.Getting a room was done without a hassle over the phone.The customer service we recieved was excellent.The staff were really nice and paid attention to every detail and made sure we had a pleasant stay in every way we could.On top of that the food we were served was unlike anything we had before.The location of the hotel makes it unique and convenient as well.Definitely the only place i'd stay when I come back.Five stars all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: anabelle_smith5
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Quality Hotel Cambridge with my other half and we booked one Deluxe City View room. The reservation was made relatively quickly over the phone without a hassle only the day before our arrival. At check in we were given our room keys to a beautiful room overlooking the city and a map of the area as well as we were interested to know a nice restaurant where we could have dinner for the evening. We were also informed the hotel has a restaurant with a nice menu on offer so we decided to dine in the hotel. The meal was delicious and one could benefit from a 2 course dinner for only $29.95. We had a great selection of wines to choose from to match the meal. After dinner we could choose to have a cocktail in the bar or have for room service. We chose to sit in the bar to enjoy the ambience. The wait staff are fantastic and knew the menu thoroughly. The restaurant, bar and lobby looked very modern and the colour changing lights did entertain. The room itself was very clean and spacious and the beds very comfortable. Car park was available at a charge and internet service was accessible although we did not need it then. Overall we have enjoyed our stay and will definitely come back with relatives next time. I would recommend this hotel for travellers on busines or on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer34433
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel from the 1st may 2010 to the 4th May 2010, and found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Loved the rooms they provided alot of room for the family. The kids enjoyed the pool. The restaurant was in the conference room due to the renovation of the air conditioning, which we found no problem with. I would definately stay here again and will recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Value and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: tinseltoes
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable 3 day stay here to sightsee around Sydney. The room was very comfortable, clean but the shower was poor. An excellent continental breakfast is provided, $5 to upgrade to a hot breakfast but we did not. TV is in a poor location - very far to the left of the bed (not that we had time to watch much TV with all the sightseeing). It is about a 15-20minute walk to Circular Quay or you can opt to get a bus in. Internet access is provided (limited to 2 computers) at a cost. It is very modern in decoration and an excellent location to get around Sydney. It is good value for anybody passing through Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average beds!”
Reviews.Author: Lozenga9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cambridge over the ANZAC Day long weekend. Staff were friendly and helpful (especially the 'In Training' lady on reception). The hotel itself was very clean and fresh on the inside. The room was spacious, with a great view from the balcony over Sydney. The only complaint I have was about the beds - so hard, and the pillows weren't much better. Ended up using the pillows from the couch, which although was not perfect, was definitely better than the pillows already provided. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to everyone - maybe just take your own pillows if you aren't used to sleeping on bricks!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, really helpful staff and beautiful and clean”
Reviews.Author: ShyKD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on the 20th of March after we went and saw Wicked the Musical. Steven Gargano the general Manager was very helpful with the booking process and all questions we had. The other staff were also really great. On the Sunday morning when we came down to have breakfast we met Adam Brooks the shift manager who was also really friendly and helpful. Only one slight downer and it was that the shower is a little difficult to regulate.Overall a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kimr06
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently and was suprised by how nice it actually was. As soon as i walked in it had a very vibrant atmosphere and was greeted by great front counter staff. We were checked in by one of the managers who was absolutely pleasant and offered us a free upgrade. The room was clean, and comfertable. had a great balcony with a great city view. I honestly couldnt tell you anything that was wrong with the room. The cupboard in the room probably needs a bit of an update but that is about it. it had 2 TV's, an ipod dock and a great bathroom. The bed was very comfertable. We spent a bit of time at the Bar and the barman was excellent. Mixed great drinks with nothing but the finest. This man needs a payrise!! The only thing i would suggest is that they get a printer in the computer area. We needed to print off our plane tickets for the next day but had to email it to the front desk so they could print it there, which caused a few problems. A small investment that would be of great service to the guests. All in all i enjoyed every little bit of my stay and WILL be coming back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Above average - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Linguaman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of trip down the East Coast in a motor home. The one big problem that we had was that we had organised parking for the first night at the hotel, ringing forward to check that we would be able to park a tall vehicle in their undergroung car park. We were told we could but when we arived this was never going to be possible and this lead to a lengthy and nervy check-in before a senior member of staff rectified the situation, providing alternative parking. This will probably not affect most travellers but is more a reflection on their communication skills. The hotel room was lovely, we were on the 14th (top) floor and it was spacious. It did however look on to a demolition site which woke us up at 9am- fine for us but if we were after a lengthy lie in, it may have been an issue. The position is great, near enough to the main road for night life, but quiet enough that you didn't feel like you were in the middle of the party. Also, the train station was not too far by foot even with our heavy bags. For what it's worth, you may want to try out "The Big RIg Diner" where the cocktails and service were exceptional and also "Billy Kwong's" where the food and staff were also wonderful, but you would have to get there very early (6pm) in order to secure a table for the night as they don't do telephone reservations.

Reviews.Title: “above average hotel, not 4-star quality”
Reviews.Author: dnpinva
Reviews.Content: There are a number of positive things about this hotel, but in in no way is it a 4-star hotel. It is an above average three-star hotel. It is worth under $150/night for the location and nicely redone bathroom. There is no gym, and there are few extra amenities. The bed was comfortable, the view extraordinary from the 14th floor, and just a couple blocks from oxford street night life (i.e., where gays go out). When I checked in, there was a light bulb out in the bathroom, and I had trouble working the safe. Service to make these repairs was very prompt. The entryway into the room itself and the area around the safe is very dark (no lighting). The cheap, dim light fixture in the room makes the room a bit depressing. Heads up, even on the 14th floor, there is road noise. The sliding glass doors to the balcony do not keep the noise out. I did smell smoke coming through the vents or the walls of the room on occasion, even though the hotel is supposedly smoke free. Be prepared to spend 15 dollars a day on wifi in the room, if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT 4 star at all”
Reviews.Author: bubbles173
Reviews.Content: This was a 2 star hotel, not what reviews state at all most definitely not a 4 star hotel at all. Minimal furniture, 2 side tables and 1 cupboard, all awful wood veneer, minimal cupboard clothing space. Curtains did not block out light in the early morning. Pillows solid rock, duvet cover was the same as disposable nicker fabric!!!our room smelt musty on arrival. Bar fridge empty bar a few sachets of milk!!what is this in a 4 star hotel. We required a double prong plug for computer connection which we had to pay $30.00 !!!Lifts were out of order mostly. I would never return to this hotel ever. Advertise what you are correctly because when you state the star rating it is what you expect to get. At least then one can make an accurate decision. Staff helpful and friendly.....

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Cambridge Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bt_mandala
Reviews.Content: We stayed at cambridge for 3 nights. The service was very friendly with nice clean rooms with a superb view of sydney city. Conveniently located at the heart of sydney city, every place is a walking distance or a quick bus ride. We will definitely be back, keep up the good work. Bivek Tamang

Reviews.Title: “OK, but certainly not great”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Crypto
Reviews.Content: This is an OK hotel. It is neither good nor particularly bad. I wouldn't recommend it or want to come back, but nor would I tell anyone not to stay here. I booked a 3 night stay through wotif.com.au costing just over AU$210. For the price the room and hotel are OK, but more like a UK Travelodge or Premier Inn than a 4* hotel. The room I was given, on the second floor, was certainly nothing like a 4* hotel (although I'm usually a 5* traveler, so might be a bit unrealistic). The bedroom was spacious and well furnished with an excellent bed. It was clean and the air conditioning worked well. On the downside, the old CRT TV (haven't seen one for years!) wasn't tuned properly nor did the remote control work well. The room was adjacent to the pool area which resulted in considerable noise in the evenings. The first time it was kids in the pool (which was meant to shut at 2000) after 2200. The second night some people decided to have a late night chat by the pool. Neither of these should be a problem if it wasn't for the hotel's paper-thin walls. On the third night it was people in a nearby room singing at 0100! Reception did, however, deal with all incidents well. The bathroom was far from satisfactory. The fittings were old and tired with many poorly repaired chips in the sanitary-ware. The shower was weak and didn't get a good temperature - being either too hot or too cold. The tiles were peeling. The view from the window was an apartment block/ service yard. This meant early morning disturbances from service vehicles. I had two breakfasts at the restaurant. They were OK, but the choice and quality was poor. I wouldn't bother. The location of the hotel should also be noted. It is located in Sydney's gay area. Although I'm not gay this wasn't a problem. In fact, the atmosphere was a lot less threatening than in other parts of a city. However, there are a large number of sex shops and various fetish retail outlets on Oxford Street close to the hotel which may be a concern for children. I don't think I'd want to stay here with a family, but it would be great for a couple! Furthermore, the section of Riley Street between the hotel and Oxford Street is poorly lit and felt threatening. A major plus of the hotel is that the staff were very helpful. On balance it was OK for a cheap hotel but don't expect anything more than a Motel. In future I'd probably spend a bit more and stay at something like a Marriott so I know what I'm getting.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room with balcony”
Reviews.Author: ebors
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and our room was ready but they wanted $20 for early check-in which was disappointing - other hotels in the area did not charge this as our other cruisers informed us. Our room was a suite with flat screen TV, balcony, settee etc. Good location, close to public transport system so was easy to get around. We bought a day tripper ticket and visited 3 beaches in one day! Good facilities in hotel but the public air conditioning slightly erratic - either cold or very warm!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: nhtourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before picking up our hire car in nearby East Sydney. We didn't get the good deal noted in another review - at $160 a night it didn't represent great value although this rate did include breakfast. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, the room was a little oddly configured but it was a corner room and very quiet so we were luckier than the previous reviewer. It was a Saturday night so the construction site opposite wasn't an issue on the Sunday morning. The breakfast was average but the room service the night before was excellent. This hotel suited our purpose but I wouldn't rave about it unless you need to be in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Kent2urist
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel by reading other people's comments. The hotel is good value for money. The rooms are a good size and are clean and comfortable but short on storage space. The bathroom was a bit dated and the sealant was mouldy but as room was cleaned every day this is a minor issue. We were able to walk to most of the sights in Sydney from the hotel although it is not centrally located. Restaurant very disappointing. Unfortunately there is a building site opposite the hotel - the construction of an apartment block has just commenced which is very noisy. We were woken up at 07:00 every week day morning. The road outside is also very busy and you can clearly hear the traffic including emergency services sirens throughout the night. Also people shouting and screaming in the street at 3 am. Not sure if the hotel is double glazed. Whilst I appreciate this is outside the hotel's control it will affect your stay. Probably ok if just a one night stay but not for a long stay. Would not stay here again until the building work opposite is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly disappointing but Lee - reception very efficient”
Reviews.Author: LinRouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed ast this hotel 3 years ago. It has undergone a revamp. The positive aspect of the hotel is that we were given a largish room with 2 double beds when we had only paid for a rollaway for the second bed, so we are very grateful for this. On thedownside the air con unit was very noisy and oyut of 5 nights, I slept one. The internet was unsatisfactory as you paid for either half an hour or an hour and if not used, you could not log on again with the same code number, which meant if you only wanted to use the internet for 10 mins, it was a waste of money. We found Lee on reception however, extremey helpful and nothing was too much trouble for him. The breakfast in the hotel was extremely disappointing, there was a very basic continental breakfast and hot dishes. The breakfast was definitely no worth the money and guests would be well advised to go down the road and get a freshly made and higher quality breakfast for the same money. I dont want people thinking we are serial moaners as I have seen negative reviews for hotels that I have stayed at with which I have disagreed. However, this is our honest pinion on this visit and we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Sydney..should be a 5 star!! :)”
Reviews.Author: migsilva
Reviews.Content: An excelente Hotel with 5 star service!!! I would like to thank the fantastic staff of Quality Hotel Cambridge for all your attentive and superb customer service, you ready made my stay very enjoyable. The rooms, the breakfast, the service are of excelent quality!! A quality hotel. The Best...would highly recommend it to all type of travellers.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Services”
Reviews.Author: novelty-traveller
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Cambridge last Thursday and found that the services was even better than the few times we stayed in the hotel last year. How could it be when its a 4 star hotel ? To our pleasant surprise, we got better services and assistance than a 5 star hotel we stayed in Sydney last month. The front desk manager Adam even remembered my name, which is rare in a city hotel. We got upgraded to a city view room which is hugh with a balcony. All staff were friendly and helpful, this time we had a few drinks in the bar and tried the cabaret dinner show which was really cool and funny. Most of all, we felt welcomed which made our stay most enjoyable. Thank you Cambridge for the best 5 star services. Will definitely stay with you guys from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: nanaof3Invercargill
Reviews.Content: Great place, staff friendly as. Good location, walking into town only took 20 min (and we are not walkers or fit!!). Breakfast was ok for the price, no problems there. Room was clean and just what we saw on their website. Would stay again for sure. Thank you to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “better than jome”
Reviews.Author: bernardsheary
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here six times over the last two years and each time it feels more like home. The staff are very friendly and helpful and will always go out of their way to make everything perfect. Which ever room i have stayed in it has always been perfectly clean and beautifully presented and the views of the city are amazing. Located in the heart of the city but it is still in a very quite area.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: UKNips
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 8 nights at this hotel and really enjoyed it. For a city break the Hotel was perfectly located, trains near by. All the staff were great and very helpful. The only compaint I would have would be breakfast, it was a little poor. Overall lovely hotel for the price

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Ashton85
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Cambridge around 12 times over the previous year as an interstate traveler. Each time I am blown away by the exceptional service, staff and effort that the hotel comes with. Every stay is accompanied by excellence in customer service and meeting my needs. Management really go out of their way to make my stay each time a little better than the last and each time exceed my expectations. I am delighted to recommend this hotel as my absolute favourite hotel in all of Sydney. Its location is perfect, the rooms are exceptional and the staff are amazing. The balconies provide stunning views and picture perfect postcards. The only thing I do wish for is some outdoor furniture on the balconies such as a table and chairs- this would make breakfast or a few drinks on the balcony overlooking beautiful Sydney a delight. Other than this I have nothing but praise for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest Boutique Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: BernieNB
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Cambridge Hotel for the first time, which I booked on the internet. I joined the Club Cambridge membership when I made the booking and received a few extras such as priority check in / out, newspapers and frequent user points etc at no additional cost. It was a plreasant surprise when we satyed in the hotel as the staff were all friendly and very helpful. The room was pretty large, clean and trendy with a hint of ' W Hotel ' theme. The food in the restaurant was excellent, equal to some of the award winning restaurants in the area. iu stayed for 3 nights for business, and my partner had a ball exploring the boutiques and cafes in surry Hills, Paddington and the City, which are all within walking distance. A great hotel and a hidden gem. We will defintely come back to the Cambridge again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel doing more”
Reviews.Author: oslolen
Reviews.Content: great location. helpful pleasant staff. crockery in room should be on shelve on wall and not on floor of cupboard. guest needs to bend down to access cups, plates etc. we used the provided washing machine. why not provide a sachet of washing powder so we do not have to get our own? room cleaner should have check list to check that shampoo is re-provisioned. butter packets provided at breakfast cafeteria are very small as are jams/marmalade. sliced bread was like cardboard paper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great Time”
Reviews.Author: stanmore1
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze - staff were very polite and helpful. Room booked was on Level 13 and gave us great views of Sydney city, Botany Bay and glimpses of the Opera house. Had dinner and watched the cabaret show in the evening - both were wonderful - especially loved the beef wellington...Breakfast in the morning was great - food was warm - staff were efficient at refilling dishes when needed.. Checking out was simple and done in a matter of minutes. All in all great room - great price - friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel just a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: MrHumphries
Reviews.Content: There are loads of positives with this hotel and just a few negatives, sort these out and it will be fantastic there. Staff - they were brilliant, always polite and helpful. They asked about any problems, I said about noise and they were going to put me in a different room if it continued. It kind of did but I didn't mention it again. The room was very nice, balcony was a great size, all nice and tidy and clean. Bathroom was decent, air con was very quiet which was great. The location is OK, we walked out most evenings and late in to the night and although we never had a problem, I didn't think it was as safe as staying at Citigate Central (CC) where I stayed last year. I can only compare against this hotel, but please note Citigate is more expensive. If Cambridge can sort out a few problems then I'd say they'd almost be equal. the bar is nice and i like all the trendy lighting going on the in the lounge/reception/bar/lifts etc. Negatives: - noise - single glazing windows means very noisy due to the location. it rained our first two nights and this made the problem worse. we were on the 8th floor and could hear people talking (although probably loudly) on the streets late at night. Some girls kept us up 2 nights (till about 2-3am) by being on the balcony next door talking, we didn't complain, but they weren't talking loudly. After about 4 days we probably got used to the noise more and slept better. police station is opposite but that doesn't produce to much noise. - breakfast - i wanted to like it, but it was a buffet for about $13.95. The food quality was low. once was enough, i expected better. i would have preferred to pay more for a better quality product. If you get over the noise issue, and perhaps either have snack bars in your room, or get breakfast elsewhere, then this hotel is very good value for money. As I said, the staff really were great and very helpful. I was able to check in at about 10am which was fantastic. I really wanted to like this place, but the noise by single glazing lets it down. There is a swimming pool but I didn't use this. Do I recommend it? Well it depends on your budget. For the cost you might not get better as it's great value. Next time I go to Sydney, I will certainly try for Citigate Central and compare the prices, try to get a deal there. If that proves too expensive, then I'll re-consider Cambridge or try my luck elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Brilliant location for staying in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: MartynandTessaNice
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked into the Cambridge for 5 days but owing to illness we ended up staying here for 24 days instead of travelling up the East Coast. The staff were very caring and looked after us extremely well. A special thanks to the two Adams and Sarah on reception and not forgetting Lee. Our rooms were lovely - we ended up on the 14th floor and had a great view over the rooftops of Sydney. Our rooms were always well serviced and well stocked with tea/coffee and nothing was too much trouble. The pool and spa were clean and lovely to relax in after a busy day sightseeing We would definitely recommend this to anyone staying in Sydney - the location is very central with a huge variety of restaurants and also very near Hyde Park and the Botanical Gardens. Circular Quay is not too far away either. We will defintely stay here again when we next visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great staff...”
Reviews.Author: buisinessbuzz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is both convenient and of great quality for its price range, I enjoyed my stay very much, my room had it's own balcony was pleasant with its cityscape view. Front desk staff were efficent and polite but a special mention must go to the friendly young lady who served us at breakfast; this lady is a credit to your establishment and her friendliness is an element of our stay which we will remember with fondness. So in conclusion a convenient, friendly hotel that I would be happy to return to in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Azcatan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cambridge Hotel in Surry Hills for a weekend away with my partner. Throughout our stay the staff were especially accommodating and friendly - nothing seemed too much for any of them, and they were all more than happy to assist with anything. Our room was clean, comfortable and spacious with a balcony and air conditioning. The bathroom was also perfectly adequate and we had everything we needed. We also enjoyed the buffet breakfast both mornings of our stay and found the food excellent and great value for money. We will definately be coming back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Such welcoming and caring hotel staff'”
Reviews.Author: camy001
Reviews.Content: The Cambridge hotel is so well situated in the vibrant and popular Oxford street area - however, more importantly than that, the hotel personnel are superb! From the moment of check-in to leaving, they were fantastic - totally understanding of the 'demands' of overseas tired visitors - nothing was to much trouble for them! I realise that many hotels receive guests from all over the world - but this hotel just 'personalises' your stay, they seem to totally appreciate that Australia is so geographically far away south and that all visitors are 'exhausted' when they arrive - thats such a nice touch and very much appreciated! Thank-you again hotel Cambridge for our third stay and for such a fantastic spacious room! My Brother has emigrtaed to Avalon - Northern Beaches, you will continue to be our hotel of choice going forward. Kind regards, Cameron Rowley, Manchester UK.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: aussieinteriors
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this centrally located hotel twice April/May 2009. The staff is fantastic, the hotel is clean. Food and beverage gets a great big plus. I had a suite w/balcony, this had great views of the city, loved it at night. As I travel to Sydney about every 2-3 years, this will be my home when I'm in town. Thanks again Camridge Quality Hotel. Sam Perales Oceanside, CA "HOME OF AMERICA'S FINEST MARINES"

Reviews.Title: “value for money, but not valued as a guest”
Reviews.Author: oz2u
Reviews.Content: We went to Sydney to see a concert at Horden Pavilion. Cambridge Hotel was within walking distance of the Pavilion and was a decent price -hence our reason for choosing it. It was easy to find, and in a great location to get around the city, but there were a few niggly things that made the stay blah. 1. Our room was RIGHT outside the pool. All level 2 and 3 rooms are in the atrium of the indoor pool - would be nice if it was outdoor and tropical. it is indoor, sweaty, and NOISY!! 2. The Maitre de in the restaurant couldn't care less. Made us feel like an inconvenience. However, the waitress was a delight!!! 5 stars to her, she was wonderful. 3. The car park is a nightmare!! Lucky we had a small car! 4.We asked for a room with a double bed (as spouses traveling together) but were put in a room with 2 single beds. All up, we got what we paid for - it was cheap and convenient.Not the worst place we've stayed, but definitely not anywhere near the best nor really the best value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Cambridge Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghChaz
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel.Staff are really nice. Room was superb. Watch if you are looking to use the WIFI as on the upper floors the connection is really poor & only 54mb not 100. Bit of noise from outside as this is in the middle of a residential area especially on a Friday night. Breakfast Buffet is ok but the Hot selection could be better.

Reviews.Title: “A fun filled weekend made even better by the Cambridge!”
Reviews.Author: shady_blonde
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for 3 nights with friends for a fun filled weekend. The hotel was incredibly clean and the staff incredibly polite and friendly. Any request was always seen too with enthusiasm and nothing was ever too much work. The recption staff helped us with directions and gave us ideas of where to eat, drink, shop which made life so much easier. We had such a fun weekend and will definately be back to stay here again. Thank you everyone for making the stay as pleasant and enjoyable as it was.

Reviews.Title: “friendly but uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: KR3W
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are very efficient and friendly. We enjoyed walking by the front desk and anytime we needed anything they were very helpful. Sadly the room wasn't easy to get to and the hallways and doors were very narrow and hard to maneuver through with any luggage. The room was ok, The air conditioning worked nicely and housekeeping kept things in clean order. Unfortunately the bed was VERY uncomfortable....sleeping on rocks with iron pillows haha. We stayed for a week and the bed got worse everyday. Also on a rainy day if you want to watch tv and stay out of the weather they only have a few channels that work, but thats minor. The only problem we had staying here was when we left one of our two room key's in a spacific spot in the room and housekeeping took it wich made us feel uneasy. We asked front desk why and they told us that they have had alot of problems with housekeeping taking keys. The buffet breakfast at the hotel was unsatisfying, The hot food was nasty! The best thing we had was toast. And the waitor working had bad mannors reaching over our plates while we were eating and without asking taking plates and glasses that we were using.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Would be back? Defenetly YES!”
Reviews.Author: brunoSydney
Reviews.Content: I arrived in November at Sydney to stay at the cambridge sydney hotel with my wife. We were coming from a long flight, more than 24hours from Portugal, we were exausted and our biggest wish was to have a bed so we could rest from such long hours. On our arrival I was impressed by the how the lobby and surrounding areas were impecable clean. As soon as I step the door a friendly staff from the reception said: " Welcome to the Cambridge Hotel, How can help you today?" a good start for what would be an excellent stay! They kindly and politely talked with us giving us all the information even before we ask, amazing customer service by the front desk, than a 5 star hotel! The room was no ready but they kindly arranged the room in less than 45 minutes which was great. During our stay there wasn't any complaint from our behalf. The facilities matched the price paid, and all the service, especially from the Front Office Department, exceeded much more the price paid! We will defenetly recomend and if there is another opporttunitie, we'll defenetly come back! Keep up the good work guys and soon what is now 4 will be 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “2 week break”
Reviews.Author: YorkshirePuddingLS9
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I thought it was nothing to write home about, But once you go through the doors my opinion soon changed I was greeted by the lovely reception staff ( I was staying here for 2 weeks so i got to know them pretty well) I purchased an advanced stay package on their website, LESS THAN $120 PER NIGHT IN SYDNEY!! the room was very nice cleaned each day and given a free newspaper!! We didnt know quite what to do in sydney, Yeah the opera house and the bridge are obvious choices but we could'nt do that for 2 weeks!!!! That was no problem the desk clerks always had ideas for us to do something and was very knowledgeable about sydney....... 2 weeks were amazing and its all thanks to the Cambridge hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect for a short city break”
Reviews.Author: LondonScout
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights , a great location and a very quick taxi ride to the airport which was handy as I woke up with just 90 minutes to check in and fly to NZ! Was surprised to get not only a bedroom but a lounge area and kitchen...excellent value, definitely recommend.Oxford St is close by, you can walk to all the major sights like the Opera House or take a bus to Bondi and check out the talent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: Amy222
Reviews.Content: i stayed there for 7 nights - for both business and vacation. The rooms are comfi and very clean, modern design. Staff is very nice and willing to assist. The location is fantastic - you can walk everywhere including opera house and darling harbour, china town, kings cross... all is very near. you have coffee shops and resturants on Oxford st. - really good location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: traveluver_9
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have stayed in for matters in service. To start we prepaid parking and found it difficult to get a standard sized car into the car park, something we were not advised on prior so if your going take a small car. Second we were unable to get a drink with our dinner as the wait staff told us they were not aloud to serve us alcohol during our meal??? Why not? The meal was horrible we needed something to wash it down with. Then after dinner it was almost impossible to find someone to get us a drink. Bed was comfortable and the room was neat and tidy which is good. 9.30am Sunday the fire alarm was set off after 10 mins we were told it was due to testing. Since we were awake we went down to have a full buffet breakfast which consisted of scrambled eggs, bacon and toast.... not very full by my standards. I advised reception on check out that I was not impressed the staff there didn't apologize we paid cash for this stay although they charged my card to so ended up paying double for one night and had to phone them to get them to refund the money to my card. Overall I understand all businesses have bad days maybe we were just unlucky and stayed on the weekend that all the rubbish staff were working.

Reviews.Title: “Our Nice stay at the Quality Hotel Cambridge”
Reviews.Author: Jea1985
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the Quality Hotel Cambridge. Everybody was very nice. The room was great, clean and tidy. Nice view from our balcony. We enjoyed every bit of it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: chris_madi_brooks
Reviews.Content: Overall we were impressed by the courteous, friendly and efficient treatment we received and delighted by the quality of our room. This was the best 'value for money' experience we have had in Sydney, and would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: OzzVic
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel situated just off Oxford St, where you will find all the cafÃ©s and restaurants and the city only a short stroll through Hyde Park .We stayed in a standard room with a queen bed and it has all the comforts that one would expect of a 4 star hotel. The staff are just great, very friendly and informative in how to get around and what to do in this great city. We took the bus to Circular Quay and jumped on a ferry for a harbor Cruise a magnificent sight. Breakfast was very good and reasonable in cost that suited our budget, we also had dinner in the restaurant on two occasions with specials offers and the food was delicious. There is an abundance of eateries to choose from on Oxford St, with a lot of ethnic influences. On one occasion we decided to venture away from the touristy sights and made our way to Paddington, the staff gave us instructions in how to get there, exceptionally friendly and professional. I would highly recommend visiting this area, amazingly well appointed terraces houses and art galleries. Our stay at the hotel was brilliant and service superb, highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for - Excellent location,friendly,professional.”
Reviews.Author: danblynch
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Cambridge Hotel 3-4 times in the last year and a half and every time I have been impressed by how professional and friendly their staff are.Check-in is made so easy as there check in desk is so friendly and helpful and will help you with any of your needs ,directions, tours etc. The Cambridge is located right by Hyde park and all public transport ,not that you need it as everything is within walking distance.They have great entertainment on a friday night as well, which is suited for all age groups. I have put family up in the Hotel and every time they come to visit they ask me to book the Cambridge for them,in my opinion you do not get a better complement than that. Dan

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Nikky1212
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel and the front desk staff were so friendly and helpful. The hotel was close to everything and made getting around sight seeing very easy!!! It was such a great place to stay and didn't cost a fortune which allowed us to travel and do so much more!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with well equipped rooms”
Reviews.Author: Olla02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quality Hotel Cambridge with my partner in november 2009. The location was excellent - a moments walk away to excellent cafes, restaurants, pubs &bars in Surrey Hills & Darlinghurst. 10-15 minutes walk into the city. 10-15 minutes walk to the botanical gardens. 5 minutes walk to the nearest train station. Very close to oxford st, where you can then catch the bus into the city/circular quay or Bondi beach. 10-15 minute walk down Oxford street towards Paddington there is great shopping (or you could just jump onto one of the many buses going down Oxford St towards Paddington). There are also nearby private galleries which are worth visiting. We stayed in a deluxe room, which had a small separate lounge area with a mini kitchen & balcony - it was very reasonably priced , clean & well equipped. There are nearby supermarkets for food provisions. Beds were comfy. We had no problems with noise at night, and so had no problems getting to sleep (Our room was towards the back of the hotel, with balcony views over neighbouring apartments & the city). I would definitely stay here again when I return to sydney. The Rocks & Circular Quay can be very touristy, which is not really our kind of thing. If you prefer to get away from the touristy areas I would recommend staying around Darlinghurst or Surey Hills - the night life is great & the area is full of energy. I thought this hotel was excellent value, there was good service from staff, and the deluxe rooms were well equipped & comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Home form Home”
Reviews.Author: PortsmouthMikey
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent holidya in Sydney which was largely attributable to our stay at the Cambridge Hotel. From the time we arrived right up untill we left we found that we were treated courteously and well looked after by all staff. he location is excellent and the hotel facilities and service second to none. We would highly reccomend this hotel for a long or short break to anybody visiting Sydney. We will certainly be staying at the Cambridge if we ever vist Sydney in the future. Mike & Brenda Portsmouth

Reviews.Title: “Not The Best !”
Reviews.Author: mking813
Reviews.Content: As a base it was fine but the hotel had clearly seen better days. First floor rooms tended to be quite noisy. Receceptionist was not very helpfull when I wanted to print out some online boarding passes. Buffet breakfast was also pretty dire for the money. Good location though and OK if your only staying a very short time. Internet by the way was ot free either,

Reviews.Title: “Was better previously”
Reviews.Author: jabiruMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This is a very well priced hotel, good location but in the past few years has gone downhill. The buffet breakfast was previously brilliant but very poor now. Service isn't too good either. We wanted to leave some bags with breakable (and expensive) items at the hotel. We were told to carry them ourselves, downstairs and leave them in some very unsecure room. Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whatalife60
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here in September 09 as part of our road trip. Lovely hotel, helpful staff, good rooms (although we were above the pool and it got very noisy when the party goers arrived back and decided to go for a swim at 2am). Free internet too which was very good. Not far to walk to Darling Harbour and Paddys Market. Car park was $18 per night and checking out took ages as there was only one lift for the car park and had to wait ages to be able to leave.

Reviews.Title: “second time stay.... still enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTourist
Reviews.Content: My partner and I came and stay at Quality Hotel Cambridge for the second time as we had good impression last time. This time we booked Bed and Breakfast through Wotif. The staff were still friendly and efficient. The room was reasonably sized. I still like the comfy bed, comfy couch and LCD TV. The shower box is still pain to close and the water temperature was still variable..... this is probably the only negative side. The breakfast was ok, basic buffet breakfast with hot food, plus continental. We turned up for breakfast on sunday morning and it was crowded and it seemed they were lack of staff thus some food was not replenished quick enough. But despite the pressure, the staff was still very pleasant and courteous. We still recommend this hotel and will return again

Reviews.Title: “Sunny Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ozbeks
Reviews.Content: Having last stayed at this hotel back in 1999 as tourists we were pleasantly surprised by the new decor and upgrading of facilities.Now living in Sydney we like to come into town and finding value for money accomodation is becoming harder. This Hotel offers great value for families with a 1 bedroom suite being ideal, especially having 2 TV's ! The room was very clean.The bathroom even had a window, a bonus in a city hotel. Close enough to all the attractions of Sydney but with an out if town price tag.A great selection of restaurants, take-a-aways and shops on the doorstep. My only worry would be the easy access for young kids to the balcony from the sofa bed in the lounge at night time.They only have to flick the catch and slide the door open.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, everything you need at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: crosNewcastle_N_S_W_
Reviews.Content: Just out of the city, with corresponding lower tariff. Room was a good size with great city views (including the Opera House). Room was clean, well maintained, very comfortable bed and nice bathroom. Parking ($18 per day) reasonable, service pleasant and helpful. Close to dozens of cafes, restaurants, pubs.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and great location”
Reviews.Author: Sammi Sue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cambridge Hotel with my husband and two children for three nights in August. We had a room with two double beds and it was quite spacious and very clean. We could walk to circular quay (about 25 mins) or to darling harbour (15 min) and even walked to Kings Cross. The location was great with many restaurants within a five minute walk. The buffet breakfast was plentiful and the kids loved it. They even had a swim in the pool. Only downer was the noise from the street on a busy Saturday night. I would recommend it and this will be my hotel of choice if I go to Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - DONT LOOK ANY FURTHER !!”
Reviews.Author: KKHSouthIsland
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed 4 nights at this hotel with an 18month old. We were first put in a room with no balcony and no portacot (both were requested) so I went to reception and asked if we could be moved and they were more than happy to relocate us (ok 1 staff member did the "have you got confirmation of this") on me but he was alright - just doing his job I guess. Anyway they gave us a city view room with our balcony and portacot and we loved it. Would recommend the front of the building - at least the 7th floor for views at night. The room was cleaned to a very high standard - the cleaning team are a credit to the hotel. We had dinner in the restaurant (which is usually hard with a little one) BUT the waiter (and it was his first night on) was soooo friendly and accomodating......even the manager came in with a small heart that changed colours for our daughter and that kept her totally amused while we enjoyed a great meal. We didnt have to use public transport as we walked to Paddys Market and the Opera House etc. Having a supermarket and bottle store across the road was handy ! I would certainly recommend this hotel - great value ! We will be back again and will request the same room. THANK YOU TO MANAGERS AND STAFF FOR YOUR REAL FRIENDLY SERVICE :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: BarneyandBambam
Reviews.Content: Friendly hotel with good location within 30 minutes walk of most of Sydney's major attractions and the harbour. Duffys supermarket just across the road from hotel for supplies. Airport transfer from hotel cheaper than train. Room bright, clean and functional. Don't miss St Mary's Cathdral an oasis for reflection ina busy city. Good buzz in the evening. Lots of restaurants and huge variety to suit all price ranges. Some 'interesting' characters about at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: etak86
Reviews.Content: We only stayed her for one night but the rooms were lovely, very clean and comfy beds. Reception staff were very helpful. Location was a little too far out if you were going to be staying for longer and there were no nearby bus/train stops not that i saw anyway but i was only there 24hours. Would definitely recommend though!

Reviews.Title: “The Tardis”
Reviews.Author: adampfb
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the outside... lets say nothing to write home about but on going inside the hotel it was like a different world. So we gave it the name "The Tardis" small and pain and the outside big and amazing on the inside. As we were travelling around Oz we didnt have a big budget and we were always looking to save money so we did a lot a booking over the internet which is where we found this great deal. Off all the hotel we stopped in ( 3-4 star) the service and rooms we the best we had come across. The reception staff could not do enough to help us by booking tours, bus times, train times, boarding passes. Their knowledge of Sydney helpped us to see the real Sydney. The rooms were worth more than we paid for modern, clean and mod-cons. Overall we enjoyed are stay and would reccomened this hotel if your going to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MeAndMyLady
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 night in July 2009. First impressions were that the room was very basic but reasonably clean. The heater unit didnt work and they provided us with one of those little tiny heater/blowers which basically was about as useful as rubbing your hands together. The bathroom was ok. We were on the 2nd floor at the rear of the hotel and were woken each morning at 6am by trucks collecting bottles/rubbish from the rear of the hotel. The hotel is very central for shopping, eating out etc etc and approx a 20min walk to Circular Quay/Opera house area. I wouldnt be in a rush to stay there again however i'm sure there are worse places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average - Won't be worth a second visit.”
Reviews.Author: Roscatz
Reviews.Content: I will start off saying the location is good. Not fantastic views but right in the heart of the city. My Girlfriend and I got the 212 deal. The room was nice but small and the bathroom was a bit grubby. It was dissappointing to find that the coating on the bathtub was chipping away. Not just a little bit. Included in the deal was dinner, where you could choose two courses from their exclusive menu. Unfortunately when we went, alot of the meals were "unavailable" that night. I would also recommend for them to get thicker windows. It was nice to be in the middle of the city but you would llike some quiet when trying to get to sleep, seeing that you a right next to Oxorf st and the Surry Hills Police Station (sirens).

Reviews.Title: “Great Tour”
Reviews.Author: lifetraveller69
Reviews.Content: I was recently on a organised bus tour from Adialiade to Brisbane. All I can say is that I have never written on site such as this.I had heard from freinds that had done this tour previously about the Quality Hotel Cambridge. It was great, good size room, by far the cleaniest hotel we stopped in on our tour.The service was very friendly and they answered our 101 questions with the upmost professionalism.Not sure what people except from hotels as I do travell a lot, and this was one of the better 4 stars that I have stopped at. Am going back to Sydney this week end and cant wait to stop at the Cambridge, a tip is that my room was front facing with a great view, my friend had a room at the back of the hotel, no view however was a lot less noisy than my room witch was at the front. If you are a light sleeper ask for a room at the back of the hotel. I would definatly reccomend that if you are going to Sydney give the Cambridge a try.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: DandJ09
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 12.05 to 22.05. Arrived 12 hours late, due to delay in Dubai. Reception staff fully aware and could not have been more helpfull. Room and cleanliness of a good standard, with room cleaned and linen/towels changed on a daily basis. We had the all inclusive package, with the buffet breakfast, which was presented to a good standard and comprised a limited, but adequate range of choice. The hotel islocated within a ten minute walk of the main shopping area. darling harbour and the bridge are a 20 minute walk. Both are served by an excellent bus service, with a stop in Oxford street, 2 minutes from the hotel. A full range of restaurants and fast food outlets are available in Oxford Street and the usual "Irish" pub, The Porterhouse is diagonally opposite the hotel, serving a full range of meals and drinks. despite other review comments, we found the laundry easy to locate and use. For the price, we would definately reccomend this hotel to your readers. Minor gripe, the wardrobe space requires to be doubled, with additional drawers, to give adequte space for two people. The air con units are noisy and the windows only single glazed, thus allowing a constant backdrop of traffic noise, but not really distracting.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: uk39
Reviews.Content: Not a fancy hotel at all. But not far from any thing. As other reviews have said about 30 to 40 minutes down to bridge. Nice walk did it many times. Buses just up the road on Oxford street. which we took as well. We found great restaurants on Oxford street. Most are BYOB which is great. We would go down to Oxford street in am and grab a tall white and breakfast to go.I can not remember the name but when you get to Oxford turn right walk maybe a block and a half and there is a little hole in the wall that makes great coffee and food to go. Don't use Internet at hotel. One just up the road from hotel in a video store. Very cheap. Only a couple of complaints which are minor. Not enough drawers in room to put your stuff. We had to live out of our suitcases. And be very careful going into bathroom. Maybe it was just our room but just in case . There was a raised metal lip just as you step into the bathroom and I did one of my toes in pretty good. We did not have any problems with front staff. All where very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctpmobile
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Cambridge Hotel for our second stay. We cannot praise this hotel enough for the price charged. The hotel offers excellent value for money and the service we experienced was equivalent or better than many other hotels we have stayed in. Some of the great things about this hotel are: Friendly Staff - when walking through reception we were always acknowledged by reception staff. Functional rooms (all have been renovated), whilst the rooms don't have all the bells and whistles that some other newer hotels offer, the rooms are perfectly comfortable and the hotel also doesn't say that it is a 5 star property. It offers rooms totally true to their advertising. Cleanliness - the housekeeping service that our room was given on each day of our stay was outstanding. The best daily service that we have had. Little things were done that we haven't seen in hotels for a long time. Food - The breakfast buffet is by no means extensive but once again for the price charged it was certainly very acceptable and enjoyable. We also had Dinner in the restaurant and had a 2 Course Dinner Special that they were offering. The Main Course was excellent and the dessert was sensational. Once again fantastic value for money. The Beds are really really really comfortable, and once again sheets and pillowcases were spotless. We would have no hesitation in recommending Cambridge Hotel to anyone wanting a great comfortable hotel offering excellent value for money with great service. Other hotels with no better location would charge much more and not offer anymore service that what the Cambridge Hotel does

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent value on the bed/breakfast included tariff”
Reviews.Author: Colin_JS
Reviews.Content: Excellent room, spotlessly clean and comfortable; all recently refurbished. Room size quite large for a city location and very good value. Breakfast buffet is rather basic and not worth paying for separately, but fine if included in the overall tariff. The hotel bar (actually in the next building, in a companion hotel) is terrible, unless you are a 'raver', very missable, even though you get one free drink voucher when checking in. Hotel staff not always friendly or helpful and there were no concierge or other services, so really just good 'no frills' accommodation. It is an easy 40 minute walk (mostly through the parks) to the Sydney Opera House and Circular Quay (for the harbour ferries). Hotel exterior and immediate location are not at all impressive, but fine inside. We did not find any decent restaurants in the immediate area but the Porterhouse Irish pub, just over the road, (though looking rough on the outside) serves excellent pub grub at very sensible prices.

Reviews.Title: “OK, serice could be better”
Reviews.Author: sil22
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews before staying at the Cambridge, it was interesting to re-read them after spending some time there. Most of the reviews are fair - the place is in a good location, the rooms are small (one bed apartments anyway) but sufficient, I found the bathrooms clean and well appointed, the breakfast is good quality but there is no variation (oh, I tell a lie, they seem to alternate between grilled tomatoes and mushrooms, otherwise, it's the same every day), yes the laundry is well hidden but is fairly cheap and at least you don't have to walk the streets looking for a launderette. The biggest disappointment is the service at the front desk. All of the desk staff are efficient enough (although they make you wait until they are ready, even when no one else is being attended to), and one or two are friendly. However, most of the staff seem to act as if they are working in a backpacker hostel - they are business-like in processing customers, there is little warmth or friendliness. I know it'snot Sydney's most expensive / exclusive hotel, but it's not the cheapest either Oh, just before I finish, the in-room Internet is a rip off (about AUS$79 a week), there are Internet cafes nearby. Finally there is a good Irish pub across the street.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK but...”
Reviews.Author: csh1960
Reviews.Content: The room was average with an odd bathroom. The glass shower door didn't have a enough room to open properly and I could have shattered it by being careless ; safety hazard there. The laundry room is actually a basement room in the underground carpark and hard to find. The desk clerk though it was funny when I had trouble finding it. I also found out that my room had an ant problem-not good! Locationwise it was fine. It was easy to go to the CBD and Oxford Street. Sydney is well served by buses, trains and a ferries.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Homeworklil
Reviews.Content: My husband & I booked into this hotel after reading reviews on trip advisor. We got a good deal at Â£57.00 per night which we though was excellent value for central Sydney. The first room we were given ha a smell so we were upgraded to a spacious room with sitting area. Good size bathroom , very comfortable bed ad bst of all quiet. Everything was walking distance iff you are fit. The Bridge takes about 40 mins to walk to. Buffet breakfast which was not included in the price was varied and good value. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Dark Hotel. Stay Clear”
Reviews.Author: Manchester_285
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located, about 10 minutes walk into town and near by parks, eateries etc though extremely dated. Having only been in Sydney for 3 or 4 days the night before we checked in we decided to have a walk to find this hotel. On arrival the lobby looked extremely bright, modern and contemporary...impressive however the service was shocking. We approached the front desk to check ou reservation was in order, it took the agent 5 mins to find the booking and informed us was a double, I said we had requested a twin and she responded "yes if we have one you can, if not then a double, thats why your allocated a double on our system" not good! After some deliberation we left, she hadnt agreed to put us in a twin, on 'her system' we remained in a double room. On arrival the next day we were presented, after the long wait to check in (15 mins) with a room key and the lift was pointed out to us. We made our way up to room which was a double, called reception, they arranged to move us, (after 30 mins). Before going out that evening we thought to do some laundry, followed signs for guest laundry and ended up in a store room in the basement with a heap of insects, chefs sat outside the room smoking and little light! We slept one night in the hotel with virtually no covers as they were full of human hair and proceeded to check out the following morning. Swimming pool and leisure facilities also had little natural ligght and were surrounded by what appeared to be internal guest rooms. Terrible experience...dont stay at this hotel, there are far, far better properties in the sydney area which offer better accom at cheaper prices and much, much better helpful and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel though not near the attractions”
Reviews.Author: Ambidextrous91
Reviews.Content: There is a lot which is very good about this hotel - The rooms were large, clean and comfortable, as well as being modern. Mine had both a settee and dining table within it. Staff were attentive and efficient, and the food offering was reasonable. The real dissapointment was the gym, which consists of a single weights machine (?!) and the pool, which is small, and doesn't work for any proper swimming. The sauna is equally dissapointing, and you have to turn it on yourself, then wait 20 mins for it to warm up. The other item worth noting is that you do not walk out into the shadows of the Opera House or Harbour Bridge - these are about 30-40 mins away - fine for me with a week in Sydney, and enjoying strolling in the sunshine, but it won't suit everyone. Ask for a high room - the lower ones suffer from the noisy road (there are a couple of pubs nearby), and note that the twin rooms come with two single beds which came as a shock as I have a king size all to myself at home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel for exploring Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Iain D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year 2008/9. Compared to the other hotels on our trip to Australia this was definitely the best. The room was plenty big enough (there were 3 of us), very clean and well appointed. Staff were friendly and helpful and the location was near enough to the centre to be walkable - in about 20 minutes down Elizabeth Street. Also close to the station - 10 mins walk. Perhaps the bit we liked most was the extremely reasonable breakfast, only 9.50 dollars for healthy and 12.95 dollars for full. Compared to some hotel breakfast rip offs that's excellent. The pool is small but good enough and there is a jacuzzi as well. Large underground car park, laundry room and two internet terminals. Very good value for money. Definitely take a close look at this one.

Reviews.Title: “ASK FOR ROOM 1306”
Reviews.Author: OggleWoggle
Reviews.Content: having previously stayed at the Cambridge some 4 years ago and were satisfied we decided to give it another go. How pleased i was to find it had been refurbished and upgraded. the room was so much nicer and the veiw from the balcony was wonderful and included the opera House. a little away from the city, you will need to take a walk to get to most of the sights, or grab a bus on nearby Oxford Street. locally there are many restaurants and cafes ( The Soup Kitchen is a must if only for the entertaining service!). if you need internet access i would reccomend going to the internet cafe in the shopping centre opposite, much cheaper than using the hotel connection. If you are booking, ask for room 1306 (deluxe Double) you wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hip Hooray!”
Reviews.Author: Summerstyle
Reviews.Content: Hi fellow travellers, I would like to tell all about a hip hotel i came across called the Cambridge in Sydney. After returning from Japan via Singapore, we were looking for something that was a little different, fashionable, clean, and in a great location to stay. This was definately it. When we arrived, we were greated by a modern lobby, two Vespa scooters, and a group of motivated receptionists, who made the check in simple, polite and quick. After a couple of drinks at the bar, (changing lights!) , we proceeded to explore the famous Oxford Street which was merely 100m away. We thoroughly enjoyed the walk, and returned to the Hotel for a well deserved rest. We had booked a Deluxe room which was large , modern, clean and comfortable. Our room also had great views of the city at night. We ordered drinks in room service and had a good night sleep on a very comfortable bed. We explored Sydney City, (10 mins walk away), with Darling harbour, Shopping and the Opera House and stayed another night before leaving. All in all, a great hotel with our recommendation. We will definately return for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: captainpaula
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip alone and after 22 hours on a plane all I wanted was a shower and a bed. I found my way to the hotel from the train station which wasn't too hard. The location of the hotel is on a side street, quite close to everything, just a few minutes walk to the park & shopping. When I arrived the hotel had no notes of my booking but after a few hours wait and a chat with the manager they eventually found it and it was worth the wait. The room was fantastic. I had a great view of the city - could even see the Opera house in the distance. The rooms are very large with a great balcony. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was spotless. There was a good flatscreen tv with a fair few channels. The room also had a couch and a small fridge with tea & coffee making facilites. The aircon was great and had a remote control which was very handy!! Staff were ok. They initially seemed a bit unsure but they were quite pleasant. All in all, I would recommend this hotel. I stayed in a hostel & two other hotels in Sydney and this was probably the best.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing at Cambridge”
Reviews.Author: UKfredd
Reviews.Content: Coming from Tasmania, we decided to enjoy a relaxing weekend in Sydney, before returning to U.K. Our travel agent recommended that we try the Cambridge in Sydney, as it was refurbished and yet inexpensive. Based on this advise, we arrived on the Friday night and was pleasantly surprised. It was new ,trendy, and in a great area, Surry Hills.
