We were given an express check in for the Deluxe Room, which was very clean, with modern furnishings and bathroom. We quickly unpacked, and proceeded to the bar for a quick drink before enjoying a walk up Oxford Street, which was great for shopping, dining and entertaining. When we returned, the staff at front desk were quite helpful in recommending what to do for our short stay in Sydney, as well as organising a wake up call, and breakfast the next day. We had a great sleep on the large bed and enjoyed breakfast the next day for $12.95 which I thought was good value. The holiday break was the best thing to do, and I can thoroughly recommenend this hotel for any holiday traveller. Its not often, that you can still find great value and service , especially in a city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average...with some problems”
Reviews.Author: newearth
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in a queen standard in Aug 2008. It was our second time there. When we stayed there first time (April 2008), the room was a lot larger with bath tub. But, this time the room was quite small with a very small bathroom. The bathroom didn't have a bath tub and very very simple style without any space where you can put even your small toiletry bag. We couldn't open the bathroom door and the shower door at the same time. The room and the bathroom were clean when we arrived. However, the next morning, the room cleaner didn't bother changing pillar cases and bed sheet (the bed was made though). We noticed that when we got back and told the reception. Someone brought two pillar cases, the bed and blanket sheets, but, without changing them himself, he just left them with us which we did it ourselves. I'm not sure if it was the hotel policy, not to change them for an environmental or ecomonical reason, or they just have a slack cleaner there. So if you'd like your bed made with clean sheets everyday, make sure you leave a notice on the bed :-)

Reviews.Title: “Does not deserve all the accolades. Average, Average!”
Reviews.Author: mella2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in a One Bedroom Suite recently. The most i can say about this place is how average it is. Location: 5 min cab ride to Pitt Street. 5 min walk to Oxford St. Cabs go up and down the street and very easy to flag down. CarPark: The pokiest carpark you will ever see. watch those corners as you try and go around tight corners...one way up and one way down! $20 per day to park Checkin: inconsistent staff. A couple of the staff were brilliant (Estella and Livia and one guy I cant remember) while the rest were grumpy and seemed overwork...which they probably are leading up to WYD. Lifts: The slowest lifts you will encounter. 2 lifts in Hotel...take forever to get back down to the lobby and then up again. On the day of check out one of them was being serviced...and the other one only hold 2 people and 2 suitcases...very small! Room: One bedroom for the price is a very good option. Small and basic lounge/kitchenette area..with small LCD TV, Microwave, Sink, tiny couch and desk. Decor was clean and fresh. Bedroom was also small with wardrobe, comfy bed and pillows. Ironing board and iron. Bathroom was also clean with shower over bath and a sink and toilet. All products and towels were updated daily. Bar/Restaraunt. Breakfast/Lunch/Dinner available....decent prizes but limited variety. Bar is very small with 4 small couch areas. Slow service. Basically this hotel is more of a upmarket Backpackers. The hotel was filled with a lot of "Groups" and the staff looked overwhelmed and "over it" a lot of the time. There are 2 computers that you can buy Internet Access at $5 for 1/2 hour. Lobby area also has TV and couches. Pool area is tiny and "Gym" has one machine which didnt work while we were there. Not your standard Quality Hotel 4 Star Property...in fact..i wonder what they spent all that money on!! Great for groups on a strict budget if you are in no hurry to go anywhere as the lifts are terrible. Service needs to be looked at...especially the attiude of management (you want to act like you work in a 5 star..then prove it!)

Reviews.Title: “Sardine Syndrome”
Reviews.Author: pomkitanner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property on two separate days in August.One reason for the choice was reviews which highlighted the refurbishment recently undertaken. If this is a definition of refurbishment I would not like to have seen our room prior. We also chose this hotel after viewing web photos of room interiors on a number of booking sites. My first impression upon entering the room was "Pokey!" We had booked a triple room and expected to find three permanent beds. Not so. Although barely acceptable for a couple this "double room" was certainly unacceptable for 3 adults. A rollaway bed was thrown into what was designed as a small lounge area thereby negating any thought of relaxing in the evening. No thought was given to extra towels,chairs, glasses etc for the third person. Upon checkout, i reminded reception of our return in 4 days and my expectation of improvement. The duty manager assured us he would take care of things.We found our room to be marginally bigger however the rollaway bed was back! AND, No extra towels,cups glasses etc. It took two more calls to reception before these were provided, (we thought grudgingly ) On a positive note , the location was excellent, walking distance to many places of interest. Great pub opposite for bar lunches. In summary this was not a comfortable stay, essentially we felt cheated! We booked and paid for a room for three adults. Not a memorable experience ! We shall not return!

Reviews.Title: “How has this hotel won awards?”
Reviews.Author: JacksonQueensland
Reviews.Content: This was extremley disappointing - especially after all the awards they seem to have won! We had a suite as there were 3 of us, it was small, dated and grim -facing the back of the buidling. They eventually wheeled in a bed which looked like a hospital bed after several calls when we realised that there was nowhere for the 3rd person to sleep. The bar service was dreadful - waited half an hour for the barman to make a Mohitio cocktail (this included time for them to run out and get mint!) when it arrived it looked like a glass of pond water and didnt taste any better - they had also poured some scary syrup like mixture from a plastic ice cream tub into the drink. The pool is small and echoey and overlooked by rooms, the gym consists of one machine. If this hotel was a hostel and prices reflected this then fine - but for the cost and the fact its rated 4 star it is wholefully out of its depth. On a positive note we did get a free upgrade to a luxury suite (basic certainly not luxury) and free drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvr1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel located near the gay area of the city. Within walking distance to good shopping, transportation very close by. Nice clean rooms, except for the large metal garbage cans located in the bathroom, the type one would find under a kitchen sink. Room overlooked the very nice swimming pool. Check-in quick and friendly, restaurant and internet also available.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but noisy”
Reviews.Author: traveller830
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as it represented good value for money for Sydney. Room was clean, but bathroom was pretty old. There was an ironing board, but no iron. The main thing to note is the noise. The rooms that overlook the pool pick up the echoes of every footstep and conversation of guests, plus the rattles and clunks of the staff cleaning trolleys in the morning. The sauna is good, gym is very basic. Staff at reception not overly helpful. Location is good - walking distance to bars and cafes at Oxford Street and through Hyde Park into the city. Overall - it's OK if there's not much else in your price range, but usually for the price you can get slightly better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy With This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: justatravelingmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first 2 nights of an 8 day stay in Sydney. Chose this hotel for its proximity to Central Station, Oxford Street, and walking distance to Paddington (restaurants, shopping). I checked out many hotels in this area by rates and reviews before deciding on this hotel. I got a very reasonable rate for the hotel by going directly to the Choice Hotels website, and prior reviews sounded like this would be a good choice. I was very happy with what I found!! It was about a 20 minute walk to the hotel from the Central Train Station (albeit uphill the way I went and pulling my suitcase). There was an area to leave my luggage as I arrived before check-in (2:00 pm) and wanted to wander the area. ($10.00 key deposit to lock up luggage, refunded when you pick up luggage and return key.) My room was good size with 2 double beds, couch, table and chairs, dresser, fridge, etc. Bathroom was large enough and everything was very clean. Beds were very comfortable!! My room was on the pool floor, but I didn't hear any noise associated with pool use. There wasn't much of a view from my room, but honestly, having a view was not a factor for me. Hotel desk staff were friendly and helpful, assisted with directions and suggested restaurants. Oxford Street was just a few minutes walk which meant plenty of shopping and restaurants, and walking along Oxford Street for a half hour or so gets you to Paddington (more shopping, food and open air market on the weekend). Little Italy was very close by too and we found some good restaurants there. There is a bar and a restaurant at the hotel, but I didn't use either except the latter for coffee to go. (I just preferred to partake in what the area had to offer.) There were 2 computers available in the lobby; $5.00 for 1/2 an hour of internet. Taxis were easy to hail from out front. I wasn't in my room much except to sleep, but I did want a hotel that I would feel safe and comfortable in, was clean, and convenient to what I wanted to do and where I wanted to go. I feel I definitely received all this, found a great value for the price, and was very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit and still as good”
Reviews.Author: Philip_Bangkok
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel having been here in 2007. You'll be pleased to know that they have 2 brand new lifts that will whiz you to your floor! This hotel really does represent great value for money and I do recommend the Deluxe rooms which are spacious and have a nice homely feel. The staff were extremely helpful whenever I asked for something and engaged in pleasant and polite conversation. For what you pay here y really can't fault it. I will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: chica_brandybuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my mum in the Deluxe Room. It was very modern and clean, and had plenty of space for us to enjoy a coffee or bite to eat without being cramped. There was a lounge and coffee table area. The bathroom was also very modern and clean, but be aware there is no bath tub. We also enjoyed a cocktail in the hotel bar which had a great atmosphere. The location is excellent. A few minutes to Oxford Street and about 15minutes walk from Central Station. We stayed here to see a show at the Lyric Theatre in Darling Harbour, as we couldnt afford anywhere in Darling Harbour itself. It only cost around $13 each way for a taxi. I am already planning to stay here next time Im in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Wonderplus
Reviews.Content: After returning from a long trip from France, I was very pleasantly surprised at the new Cambridge Hotel, after refurbishment. I have stayed in this Hotel before because I like the nightlife around Oxford Street and the convience to the city. On my return visit, I was thoroughly impressed with the new foyer, new rooms, and higher levels of service and hospitality. Surprisingly the rooms rates are also quite reasonable considering it is a city Hotel. I will definately recommend this Hotel to any of my friends that will visit Sydney. I particularly like the Hotel because of its modern and unique feel, not just another copy of another chain Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and value for money”
Reviews.Author: luckytraveller08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just arrived home from a wonderful 4 week holiday in Australia. We researched our hole trip via the web and booked all flights and hotel via the web. Our highlight was Sydney and I must say we had 6 of the most memorable days of our life, We did a lot of research on hotels including Tripadvisor. We decided on The Quality Hotel Cambridge as it offered the price point we were looking for in what turned out to be a fantastic location. We were a little unsettled as their were so many varying reviews. I must say our concerns were unfounded. We walk in after a very long flight witch arrived early in the morning. We were greeted by a very bright modern lobby, with very friendly staff. We did have to wait a wile for our room as check-in was not until 2.00 PM( handy to know if you are arriving early), we were well looked after and the reception staff were very helpful. A young English gentleman was the front desk manager and during our stay went out of his way to accommodate us.In fact all staff on front desk were very knowledgeable and helpful.We were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived in our room (we booked a deluxe room 1307) it was very large and well appointed. It had a balcony with great views across the city. Had a small fridge and a very comfortable bathroom. The bed was the most comfortable that we have sleep in. In our four weeks of travel we stopped in many hotels and the Cambridge cleanliness of was top notch, actually the best I have ever experienced. The location while not being in the centre of the city was good and very easy to get to all site seeing attractions. We highly recommend this hotel and it truly was the best hotel we stopped in.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: sparklykendall
Reviews.Content: We got here quite late and though they seem to have a bit of confusion over our booking (we wondered if they'd lost it) but we were soon given a key to quite a large room on the 15th floor -maybe an upgrade -if not it was impressive. All very clean and modern decoration with a good view over the city. We only stayed here for one night as a stopover and didn't do breakfast but seemed like good value and centrally located. There is parking and luckily we had a small car as it is quite a tight squeeze to get in the car park. Would recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “clean room”
Reviews.Author: sandymc
Reviews.Content: had booked this hotel for three nights with ratestogo.com very reasonable, the room with twin double beds was overlooking the swimming pool, could be a bit noisy with people in the pool early in the morning, the hotel was clean and modern the reception staff were, shall we say not over helpful and internet access was $5 for 30 minutes, dont bother with it there is an internet cafe 2 minutes away next to the supermarket at half the price.A 30 minute walk will take you to the opera house and on to Circular Quay, you can also get to Darling Harbour in 30 mins. There is a laundry facility available with machines and driers priced at $4 each.also irons and boards. It is a fairly busy area just off Oxford Street and close to Hyde Park. Be aware there does appear to be a lot of gays in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy bath, awful toilet, and super noisy”
Reviews.Author: travelyun
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights during Easter this year, it was awful. First the positive - the whole place is very modern,just recently done up. However, the room we got was very small, (room number 1004), the sink water left the sink and then appeared from a whole on the floor, bringing with it some rather disgusting things. So needless to say the toilet as a whole was not that usable afterwards. The hot water was very temperamental - for a five minute shower, I had to constantly adjusted it, as it never stayed the same tempreture. The pressure was also inconsistent. Then it was the noise - a pub nearby made sure every noise it had would travel right over there, till 4am. The location wasn't that great either - to go anywhere you at least need to walk 10-15 minutes. Granted we might have been given the worst room, but we certainly will not stay there ever again. It wasn't cheap either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice website - shame about the room”
Reviews.Author: beanbagdan
Reviews.Content: "Wow" I thought as I looked at the hotel website (www.cambridgeinn.com.au) after my company booked me here. With an impressive front desk area all seemed just right...until I opened the door to room 104. What a disappointment! Ugly, old furniture and dark bathroom all a la 1960s...and two of the smallest single beds I have seen in years. The "window" was opaque frosted glass. Where oh where were the flat screen tvs, clean new carpet and the rooms to match the money they have spent on the lobby? Room 104 just so happens to be right next to the cleaners' catch up area, so expect banging of trolleys, gossip and laughing at 7am. If I wasn't so tired, i would have taken photos, as their website claims that the hotel won an Award for "Most Improved Hotel 2007"...well the judges never went into Room 104....the room that time forgot.

HotelInfo.Name: Cambridge Hotel Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 212 Riley Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2010, Australia (Formerly Quality Hotel Cambridge)
